Title: Cisco ASA 5500-X Session Initiation Protocol Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) data to cause a target device to reload or to cause high CPU consumption on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvm43975 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20181031-asaftd-sip-dos

Title: Cisco ASA Lets Remote Users Bypass the Per-User-Override Firewall Feature
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can bypass the per-user-override feature configured on a specific interface of the target firewall.

The system must have at least one interface using the affected feature and must also have at least one remote access VPN connection profile or site-to-site VPN connection profile (tunnel-group) configured and associated with a group policy (group-policy) that specifies a filter ACL (vpn-filter) and must also have a VPN tunnel associated with an affected connection profile (tunnel-group) to be affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj91858 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the firewall to access hosts or resources on the protected network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20181003-asa-acl-bypass

Title: Cisco ASA DMA Access Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user can send a high rate of specially crafted data to the target system to consume a limited amount of Direct Memory Access (DMA) data and cause the target device to temporarily reload.

ASA 5506-X
ASA 5506H-X
ASA 5506W-X
ASA 5508-X
ASA 5516-X

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj89470 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20181003-asa-dma-dos

Title: Cisco ASA Traffic Flow Confidentiality Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an error that may occur if the device renegotiates the encryption key while Traffic Flow Confidentiality (TFC) via IPsec is in process and cause a daemon on the target device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy57310 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20181003-asa-ipsec-dos

Title: Cisco ASA Bug in TCP Syslog Module Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between the target Cisco ASA router and the target TCP syslog server can send specially crafted data to consume the 1550-byte buffers on the target device. As a result, all TCP-based features, including AnyConnect SSL VPN, clientless SSL VPN, and management connections (e.g., Secure Shell (SSH), Telnet, HTTPS), will stop functioning.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh73829 to this vulnerability.

J-M Roth reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause all TCP-based functions on the target TCP logging system to stop functioning.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20181003-asa-syslog-dos

Title: Cisco ASA 5500-X Series IPsec Driver Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA 5500-X Series. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPsec Authentication Header (AH) or Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) packets to cause the target system to crash.

The ASA 5506-X, 5508-X, and 5516-X series appliances are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvf73114, CSCvg37952, CSCvh04189, CSCvh04591, and CSCvi30496 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180926-ipsec

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Management Web Interface Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the management web interface to shutdown all management sessions and cause all logged in users to be redirected to the login page.

Mario Aaron Lopez Payes reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can shutdown all management sessions and cause all logged in users to be redirected to the login page.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.1.3).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/129

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in GlobalProtect Gateway Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 6.1.21 and prior, 7.1.18 and prior, 8.0.11 and prior
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The GlobalProtect Gateway interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Systems using PAN-OS GlobalProtect gateway are affected.

Brandon Freshour reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1.19, 8.0.12).

No fix is planned for version 6.1.21.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/128

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users View Hashed Passwords on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can obtain hashed passwords on the target system.
A remote authenticated administrator user can modify HTML markup on the management web interface to obtain GlobalProtect password hashes of local users.

Bill Chaison from GCI Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrator user can obtain hashed passwords on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.21, 7.1.17, 8.0.9, and 8.1.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/124

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Management Interface Parameter Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Delete Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can delete files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can supply specially crafted request parameters to exploit a flaw in the Management interface and delete files on the target system.

Xinming Nie with Aisinfo-Sec reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can delete files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.21, 7.1.17, 8.0.10).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/123

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Session Browser Lets Remote Authenticated Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote authenticated user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The PAN-OS session browser is affected.

Davide 'Peru' Peruzzi - GoSecure! reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.21, 7.1.17, 8.0.10, and 8.1.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/126

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Administration Page Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote authenticated user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A PAN-OS web interface administration page is affected.

Davide 'Peru' Peruzzi - GoSecure! reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.21, 7.1.18, 8.0.11-h1, and 8.1.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/125

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in URL Filtering 'continue page' Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The URL Filtering 'continue page' and 'admin override page' does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Ayushman Dutta reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.11).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/122

Title: Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS SSL-VPN Web Portal Bookmark Feature Lets Local Users View Passwords
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS. A local user can obtain passwords on the target system.
When a user bookmarks a page in the SSL-VPN portal that uses single sign-on (SSO), the web portal returns the target user's login and password in plain text in a javascript file. A local user on the target user's system can obtain the password.

Stephan Neidhardt - link protect GmbH reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user on the target user's system can obtain the target user's password in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.0.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-18-027

Title: Cisco ASA HTTP URL Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the target device to cause the device to reload or disclose potentially sensitive information.

The following models are affected:

3000 Series Industrial Security Appliance (ISA)
ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall 
ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
ASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)
Firepower 2100 Series Security Appliance
Firepower 4100 Series Security Appliance
Firepower 9300 ASA Security Module
FTD Virtual (FTDv)

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi16029 to this vulnerability.

Michal Bentkowski from Securitum reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target system to reload.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180606-asaftd

Title: Fortinet FortiOS fnsysctl Command Lets Local Administrative Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiOS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local administrative user with super_admin privileges and with a connected USB drive can cause the fnsysctl CLI command to execute arbitrary code from the USB drive with elevated privileges.

Shaanan Cohney of University of Pennsylvania reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local administrative user with super_admin privileges can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.4.9, 5.6.3).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-17-245

Title: Cisco ASA TLS Buffer Underflow Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Transport Layer Security (TLS) message to an interface on the target device that has SSL enabled to trigger a buffer underflow in the TLS library and cause the target device to reload.

Cisco Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv) is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCve18902, CSCve34335, and CSCve38446 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.2.4.27, 9.4.4.13, 9.6.3.20, 9.7.1.16, 9.8.2.14).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-asa3

Title: Cisco ASA Ingress Software Lock Error Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can send a stream of specially crafted IP packets to create connections on the target device and exploit an internal software lock error and consume excessive CPU resources on the target system. As a result, traffic through the target device may be delayed.

The following models are affected:

ASA 5500 Series
ASA 5500-X Series
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series and Cisco 7600 Series
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliances (ASAv)

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf63718 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system and cause traffic through the target system to be delayed.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1.7.20, 9.2.4.27, 9.4.4.13, 9.6.3.17, 9.6.4.6, 9.7.1.16, 9.8.2.14, 9.9.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-asa2

Title: Cisco ASA SSL VPN Client Certification Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Establish an SSL VPN
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can establish an SSL VPN connection.
A remote user can bypass the SSL VPN client certificate authentication function to establish an SSL VPN connection without a proper private key and certificate pair.

The following models are affected:

ASA 5500 Series
ASA 5500-X Series
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series and Cisco 7600 Series
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliances (ASAv)

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg40155 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can establish an SSL VPN connection without a proper private key and certificate pair.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.4.4.14, 9.6.3.20).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-asa1

Title: Cisco ASA Application Layer Protocol Inspection Logic Errors Let Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send a high volume of specially crafted traffic through the target device to trigger logic errors in the Application Layer Protocol Inspection feature and cause the device to reload.

The following models are affected:

ASA 5500 Series
ASA 5500-X Series
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series and Cisco 7600 Series
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliances (ASAv)

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCve61540, CSCvh23085, and CSCvh95456 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.6.4.6, 9.7.1.24, 9.8.2.24, 9.9.1.4).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-asa_inspect

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in Clientless SSL VPN Portal Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The 'Web Server Authentication Required' screen of the Clientless Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) VPN portal does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN portal and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The following models are affected:

ASA 5500 Series
ASA 5500-X Series
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series
ASA Services Module for Cisco 7600 Series
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh20742 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN portal, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-asawvpn2

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in WebVPN Management Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The WebVPN web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the WebVPN web-based management interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg33985 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WebVPN web-based management interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-asawvpn

Title: Cisco ASA AnyConnect Client SAML SSO Flaw Lets Remote Users Establish Authenticated AnyConnect Sessions in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can establish an authenticated AnyConnect session in certain cases.
A remote user that can hijack a valid authentication token can use the token to establish an authenticated AnyConnect session through the target device.

Systems configured with SAML 2.0 Identity Provider (IdP), SAML 2.0 Service Provider (SP), and AnyConnect Remote Access VPN are affected.

The following models are affected:

ASA 5500 Series
ASA 5500-X Series
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series and Cisco 7600 Series
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg65072 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can establish an authenticated AnyConnect session in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.7.1.24, 9.8.2.28, 9.9.2.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-asaanyconnect

Title: Cisco ASA Double-Free Memory Error in SSL VPN Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted XML packets to the target webvpn-configured interface to trigger a double-free memory error in the SSL VPN function and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Systems with the webvpn feature enabled are affected.

The following models are affected:

3000 Series Industrial Security Appliance (ISA)
5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls
ASA Services Module for Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and 7600 Series Routers
1000V Cloud Firewall
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)

Several Firepower series devices are also affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg35618 to this vulnerability.

Cedric Halbronn from the NCC Group reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a revised fix (9.1.7.23, 9.2.4.27, 9.4.4.16, 9.6.4.3, 9.7.1.21, 9.8.2.20, 9.9.1.2).

[Editor's note: On February 5, 2018, the vendor updated their advisory to announce that additional vulnerabilities have been identified, that the original fixes in the January 29, 2018 advisory are incomplete, and that new fixed versions are available. The fixed versions listed above are the new fixed versions.]

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180129-asa1

Title: Fortinet FortiOS Input Validation Flaw in Host Header Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiOS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'Host:' header before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Fortinet FortiOS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Dhiraj Shrikant Datar, Paramount Computer Systems FZ LLC reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Fortinet FortiOS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.4.8, 5.6.3).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-17-262

Title: Juniper ScreenOS Etherleak Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information from Unpadded Ethernet Packets
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper ScreenOS. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
The system does not pad unused portions of Ethernet packets. A remote user on the local network that can monitor the packets can obtain potentially sensitive information from fragments of system memory that are included in the Ethernet packets.

The vendor has assigned PR 1281648 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.3.0r25).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10841

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS RSA TLS Implementation Lets Remote Users Decrypt Data Communicated By the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can decrypt data communicated by the target system.
A remote user with access to network traffic or that is able to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit the RSA implementation for TLS sessions and conduct an adaptive chosen ciphertext attack (known as a Bleichenbacher attack) to decrypt and recover plaintext.

This attack method is known as the "ROBOT" attack.

The origin advisory ("Return Of Bleichenbacher's Oracle Threat") is available at:

https://eprint.iacr.org/2017/1189

Hanno Bock, Juraj Somorovsky of Ruhr-Universitat Bochum / Hackmanit GmbH, and Craig Young of Tripwire VERT reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with access to network traffic or that is able to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt and recover plaintext.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.7; a fix for 6.1 and 7.1 will be included in the next available maintenance update).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/117

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Captive Portal Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Captive Portal interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Shaun Wheelhouse reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.7).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/114

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in GlobalProtect Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The PAN-OS GlobalProtect interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Systems with either the gateway or the portal configured are affected.

Oliver Briem from Paypal Inc. reported this vulnerability.

The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.19, 7.0.19, 7.1.14, 8.0.7).

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Multiple Management Interface Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System with Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote user can exploit a combination of vulnerabilities in the management interface to execute arbitrary commands on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.

A remote user can exploit a deserialization error in processing the PHPSESSID cookie to modify the session file, triggering an XML injection cookie injection error, which bypasses the panAuthCheck authentication directive controlling access to the '/php' directory. A remote user can then conduct an XML injection attack against the '/php/utils/router.php' script to create arbitrary directories on the target system. A remote user can then conduct a command injection attack against the '/usr/local/bin/genindex_batch.sh' cron script to execute arbitrary system commands with root privileges.

The vendor was notified on July 9, 2017.

Philip Pettersson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.19, 7.0.19, 7.1.14, 8.0.6).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/102

Title: Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS SSL-VPN Input Validation Flaw in login redir Parameter Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Open Redirect Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS SSL-VPN. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site.

The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The login redir parameter is affected.

Stefan Viehbck from SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.6.3, 5.4.6 special build, pending version 5.4.7, 5.2.12 special build, pending version 5.2.13).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-17-242

Title: Fortinet FortiOS WPA/WPA2 Protocol Key Reinstallation Attack Lets Remote Users Access and Modify Data on the Target Wireless Network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Fortinet FortiOS. A remote user on the wireless network can access and modify data on the wireless network.
A remote user within range of the wireless network can record and replay retransmissions of part of the 802.11i 4-way handshake of the WPA and WPA2 protocols to force a reinstallation of the pairwise transient key, a group key, or an integrity key and force a reset of the incremental transmit packet number nonce and the receive replay counter. As a result, the remote user can replay encrypted packets, decrypt packets, and forge packets.

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the pairwise encryption key (PTK-TK) [CVE-2017-13077].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the group key (GTK) [CVE-2017-13078, CVE-2017-13080].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the integrity group key (IGTK) [CVE-2017-13079, CVE-2017-13081].

FortiWifi models operating in Wifi Client mode are affected.

This set of vulnerabilities is referred to as KRACK (Key Reinstallation AttaCK).

The original advisory is available at:

https://papers.mathyvanhoef.com/ccs2017.pdf

Additional information is available at:

https://www.krackattacks.com/

[Editor's note: The vulnerabilities reside in the WPA and WPA2 protocol specification and are not due to incorrect vendor implementation of the standards.]

Mathy Vanhoef and Frank Piessens from Katholieke Universiteit Leuven reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can access and modify data on the wireless network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.6.2 special build, available via local TAC).

The fix will also be included in pending versions 5.2.12, 5.4.6, and 5.6.3.

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-17-196

Title: Juniper ScreenOS WPA/WPA2 Protocol Key Reinstallation Attack Lets Remote Users Access and Modify Data on the Target Wireless Network
Version(s): 6.3; SSG-5 and SSG-20 devices (with embedded Wireless Access Points radios)
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Juniper ScreenOS. A remote user on the wireless network can access and modify data on the wireless network.
A remote user within range of the wireless network can record and replay retransmissions of part of the 802.11i 4-way handshake of the WPA and WPA2 protocols to force a reinstallation of the pairwise transient key, a group key, or an integrity key and force a reset of the incremental transmit packet number nonce and the receive replay counter. As a result, the remote user can replay encrypted packets, decrypt packets, and forge packets.

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the pairwise encryption key (PTK-TK) [CVE-2017-13077].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the group key (GTK) [CVE-2017-13078, CVE-2017-13080].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the integrity group key (IGTK) [CVE-2017-13079, CVE-2017-13081].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the STK key in the PeerKey handshake [CVE-2017-13084].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the Tunneled Direct-Link Setup (TDLS) PeerKey (TPK) key in the TDLS handshake [CVE-2017-13086].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the group key (GTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame [CVE-2017-13087].

A remote user on the wireless network can reinstall the integrity group key (IGTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame [CVE-2017-13088].

The vendor has assigned PR 1297300 to these vulnerabilities.

This set of vulnerabilities is referred to as KRACK (Key Reinstallation AttaCK).

The original advisory is available at:

https://papers.mathyvanhoef.com/ccs2017.pdf

Additional information is available at:

https://www.krackattacks.com/

[Editor's note: The vulnerabilities reside in the WPA and WPA2 protocol specification and are not due to incorrect vendor implementation of the standards.]

Mathy Vanhoef and Frank Piessens from Katholieke Universiteit Leuven reported these vulnerabilities. John Van Boxtel from Cypress reported one vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can access and modify data on the wireless network.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10827

Title: Cisco ASA 5506W-X WPA2 Protocol Key Reinstallation Attack Lets Remote Users Modify Data on the Target Wireless Network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA 5506W-X. A remote user on the wireless network can modify data on the wireless network.
A remote user within range of the wireless network can record and replay retransmissions of part of the 802.11i 4-way handshake of the WPA and WPA2 protocols to force a reinstallation of certain keys.

A remote user on the wireless network can retransmit the Fast BSS Transition (FT) Reassociation Request and reinstall a previously used pairwise encryption key (PTK-TK).

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCvf47808 to this vulnerability for Cisco ASA 5506W-X with FirePOWER Services.

This vulnerability is one of a set of vulnerabilities referred to as KRACK (Key Reinstallation AttaCK).

The original advisory is available at:

https://papers.mathyvanhoef.com/ccs2017.pdf

Additional information is available at:

https://www.krackattacks.com/

[Editor's note: The vulnerability resides in the WPA and WPA2 protocol specification and is not due to incorrect vendor implementation of the standards.]

Mathy Vanhoef and Frank Piessens from Katholieke Universiteit Leuven reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can modify data on the wireless network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.3.130.0).

No solution was available at the time of this entry for versions 8.2, 8.5, and 8.6.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171016-wpa

ASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers
ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)
Firepower 4110 Security Appliance 
Firepower 9300 ASA Security Module
ISA 3000 Industrial Security Appliance 

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd59063 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-asa

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:

The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. Title: WatchGuard Firebox XML-RPC Interface Bugs Let Remote Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in WatchGuard Firebox. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can send a specially crafted login request to the XML-RPC interface to cause the target wgagent service to crash, causing all user interface sessions to be logged out. An XML message containing an empty member tag can trigger this flaw.

The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the user tag of the login function of XML-RPC inteface before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser when viewing the 'Traffic Monitor' 'Events' and 'All' sections. The code will originate from the WatchGuard Firebox web user interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Impact':
A remote user can cause web user interface sessions to be logged out.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WatchGuard Firebox web user interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.0).

Title: Cisco ASA 5500-X Series OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the OSPF LSA Database to Take Control of the Target Autonomous System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA 5500-X Series firewalls. A remote user can modify the OSPF LSA database to take full control of the target Autonomous System.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packet from a valid or spoofed address to the target system's OSPF multicast address or to an OSPF-enabled interface on the target system to flush the routing table on the target system and inject arbitrary routes. This can be exploited to establish false routes and route traffic to a black hole or to an arbitrary destination.

The remote user must know or guess certain parameters of the target system to exploit this vulnerability, such as IP addresse, LSA DB sequence numbers, and the router ID of the OSPF Designated Router.

OSPFv3 and FSPF are not affected by this vulnerability.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve47393 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the routing table and take full control of the target Autonomous System.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170727-ospf

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Management Web Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The management web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS management web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Juan Lopez of Inqwest reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS management web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.18, 7.0.16, 7.1.11, 8.0.3).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/89

Gaku Mochizuki/Toshitsugu Yoneyama from Mitsui Bussan Secure Directions, Inc. (via JPCERT/CC) and Craig Young, Principal Security Researcher, Tripwire VERT reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote authenticated user with the 'security' role can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Juniper ScreenOS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10782

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) wget HTTP Redirect Bug Lets Remote Users Write Files on the Target System
Version(s): 6.1.16 and prior, 7.0.14 and prior, 7.1.9 and prior, 8.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in wget. A remote user can write files on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote server can return a specially crafted HTTP redirect message with an FTP server Location value to cause the target user's wget application to download and write or overwrite an arbitrary file from the specified FTP server to the target user's current directory.

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) Linux Kernel Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information About, Deny Service, and Hijack Target TCP Connections in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linux kernel. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information about a target TCP connection in certain cases. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions against the target TCP connection or hijack the target TCP connection in certain cases. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote user can conduct a side-channel attack against TCP connections to determine if two arbitrary hosts have established a TCP connection and to potentially hijack the connection in certain cases.

A remote user that can establish a separate TCP connection to the target system can send specially crafted TCP RST and TCP SYN packets to cause the target system to respond with a number of challenge ACK packets that exceed the target system's challenge ACK maximum while at the same time sending spoofed packets with a source address of a second target system to the first target system. If the total maximum number of challenge ACK packets are returned to the remote user from the first target system, then the remote user can infer that a connection does not exist between the two target systems. If fewer than the maximum number of challenge ACK packets are returned to the remote user from the first target system, then the remote user can infer that there is an established TCP connection between the two target systems.

A similar attack method can be used to determine correct TCP sequence numbers for a target TCP connection and then hijack the target connection.

The report indicates that an attack can be completed within 60 seconds or less, on average, and with an 88% to 97% success rate.

The vulnerability resides in the challenge ACK response mechanism and global rate limit mechanism specified in RFC 5961 and as implemented in the Linux kernel.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.usenix.org/system/files/conference/usenixsecurity16/sec16_paper_cao.pdf

Yue Cao, Zhiyun Qian, Zhongjie Wang, Tuan Dao, of Srikanth V. Krishnamurthy of University of California, Riverside, and Lisa M. Marvel of US Army Research Laboratory reported this vulnerability at the 25th USENIX Security Symposium, Austin, Texas.
Impact':
A remote user can determine if two arbitrary hosts have established a TCP connection in certain cases.

A remote user can tear down a target TCP connection in certain cases.

A remote user can hijack a target TCP connection in certain cases.
Solution:
The Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix (7.1.10).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/85

Title: Fortinet FortiOS Input Validation Flaw in 'global-label' Configuration Setting Lets Remote Authenticated Administrative Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks

The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote authenticated administrative user with write privileges can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'global-label' hidden CLI configuration setting is affected.

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in GlobalProtect External Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network

Title: Cisco ASA TCP Normalizer Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
The TCP normalizer does not properly limit the global out-of-order TCP queue for specific block sizes. A remote user can send a large number of specially crafted TCP connections with out-of-order segments to consume all available blocks in the global out-of-order TCP queue and cause the target device to drop all subsequent traffic on all interfaces.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb46321 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the system to drop all subsequent traffic on all interfaces.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

Title: Cisco ASA DNS Response Message Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can return a specially crafted DNS response to the target system to trigger a flaw in the processing of DNS response messages and cause the target system to reload or corrupt information in the target system's local DNS cache.

Systems configured in routed or transparent firewall mode and single or multiple context mode are affected.

The following models are affected:

ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall 
ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
ASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv) 
Firepower 9300 ASA Security Module
ISA 3000 Industrial Security Appliance

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb40898 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload or corrupt information in the target system's local DNS cache.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1(7.12), 9.2(4.18), 9.4(3.12), 9.5(3.2), 9.6(2.2)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-asa-dns

Title: Cisco ASA IPsec Parsing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote authenticated user with a valid IPsec tunnel can send specially crafted IPsec packets to the target system to trigger a parsing error and cause the target system to reload.

Systems configured in routed firewall mode only and in single or multiple context mode are affected.

The following models are affected:

ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall 
ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
ASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls
ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv) 
Firepower 9300 ASA Security Module
ISA 3000 Industrial Security Appliance

Systems configured to terminate only Clientless SSL or AnyConnect SSL VPNs are not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun16158 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1(7.8), 9.2(4.15), 9.4(4), 9.5(3.2), 9.6(2)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-asa-ipsec

Title: WatchGuard Firebox XML-RPC Agent Bugs Let Remote Users Determine Validation Usernames and Deny Service on the Target System
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in WatchGuard Firebox. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
A remote user can send multiple requests with specially crafted XML data that references an external entity to cause the target XML-RPC agent to crash or degrade performance. As a result, the web user interface may become unavailable for 10 minutes and traffic traversing the firewall may be disrupted or slowed.

The XML-RPC agent returns different responses to authentication requests depending on whether the username exists on the system or not. A remote user can send a specially crafted request to the target XML-RPC agent to determine valid usernames on the target system.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sidertia.com/Home/Community/Blog/2017/04/17/Fixed-the-Fireware-Vulnerabilities-discovered-by-Sidertia

David Fernandez of Sidertia Solutions reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the web user interface to become unavailable and traffic traversing the firewall to be disrupted or slowed.

A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.12.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://www.watchguard.com/support/release-notes/fireware/11/en-US/EN_ReleaseNotes_Fireware_11_12_2/index.html#Fireware/en-US/resolved_issues.html%3FTocPath%3D_____13

     ASA5545-X
     ASA5555-X

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170201-fpw2

Title: Cisco ASA CX Context-Aware Security Module IP Fragment Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA CX Context-Aware Security Module. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP fragments through the module to consume free packet buffers in shared memory and cause the module to stop processing traffic.

Traffic specifically directed toward the module by the Modular Policy Framework (MPF) configuration on the parent Cisco ASA is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva62946 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target module and cause the module to stop processing traffic.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

[Editor's note: The ASA CX module has entered the end-of-life (EoL) process and the vendor does not plan to issue a fix.]

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170125-cas

Description:
