A local user can obtain the administrative password hash.

Bryan Schmidt reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain the administrative password hash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2.10, 5.4.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://fortiguard.com/advisory/FG-IR-16-050

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Web Management Server Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the web management server and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Tavis Ormandy from the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.15, 7.0.11, 7.1.6).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/68

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Environment Variable Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can set specially crafted environment variables to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system with elevated privileges.

Tavis Ormandy from the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.15, 7.0.11, 7.1.6).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/67

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Captive Portal Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The captive portal interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS captive portal interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

David Vassallo reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS captive portal interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.15, 7.0.11, 7.1.5).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/66

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Addresses Object Parsing Function Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject XPath Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can inject XPath commands.
The Addresses Object parsing function does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted request to modify XPath queries and obtain potentially sensitive information.

Khalilov Mukhammad from HelpAG reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute XPath queries on the target system to obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.15, 7.0.11, 7.1.6).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/70

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSH Lets Remote Users Determine Valid Usernames on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request with a large password (approximately 10,000 characters) to the target ssh daemon to determine valid usernames on the target system. On systems where a valid user's password has been hashed with SHA256/SHA512, the response time will be shorter for a non-existent username than for a valid username.

Eddie Harari reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix (6.0.15, 6.1.15, 7.0.11, 7.1.6).

Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/69

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary XML Commands on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can execute arbitrary XML commands on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted XML data via HTTP to exploit an input validation flaw in the web-based management interface and execute arbitrary XML commands on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva38556 to this vulnerability.

Adam Willard, Raytheon Foreground Security, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary XML commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (96.2(0.95), 97.1(6.30), 97.1(12.7), 97.1(0.55), 100.8(40.129), 100.15(0.137), 100.11(0.75)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161116-asa

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Insecure API Token Generation Lets Remote Users Access the Target Firewall API Interface
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can gain access to the target firewall API interface.
The system does not properly generate and process API authentication tokens for the firewall API interface. A remote user that can access an authenticated administrator's browser and can obtain the firewall API authentication token can perform calls to the firewall API.

Travis Christianson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target firewall REST API.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.15, 7.0.11, 7.1.5).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/65

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Captive Portal Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Captive Portal interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

David Vassallo reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS Captive Portal interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.15, 7.0.11, 7.1.5).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/66

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSL Double Free Memory Error in ssl3_get_new_session_ticket() Has Unspecified Impact
Version(s): 5.0.19 and prior, 5.1.12 and prior, 6.0.13 and prior, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.7
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. The impact was not specified. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote server can return a specially crafted NewSessionTicket message to a connected multi-threaded client to cause the client to attempt to reuse a previous ticket and trigger a race condition. As a result, a double free memory error may occur in ssl3_get_new_session_ticket().

Emilia Kasper of the OpenSSL development team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2015-1791 for Palo Alto PAN-OS.

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/61

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 5.0.19 and prior, 5.1.12 and prior, 6.0.13 and prior, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.7
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted application data to a connected DTLS peer between the ChangeCipherSpec and Finished messages to trigger an invalid memory free and cause a segmentation fault or memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-8176]. Versions 0.9.8 prior to 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 prior to 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 prior to 1.0.1h are affected.

Praveen Kariyanahalli and Ivan Fratric and Felix Groebert of Google separately reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted ECParameters to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2015-1788]. Applications that process public keys, certificate requests, or certificates are affected. TLS clients and TLS servers with client authentication enabled are affected. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

Joseph Birr-Pixton reported this vulnerability on April 6, 2015.

A remote user can create a specially crafted certificate or certificate revocation list (CRL) that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an out-of-bound memory read in X509_cmp_time() and cause a segmentation fault [CVE-2015-1789]. TLS clients that verify CRLs are affected. TLS clients and servers with client authentication enabled and that use custom verification callbacks may be affected.

Robert Swiecki of Google reported this vulnerability on April 8, 2015 and Hanno Bock independently reported this vulnerability on April 11, 2015.

A remote user can create specially crafted ASN.1-encoded PKCS#7 data with a missing EnvelopedContent component to trigger a null pointer dereference [CVE-2015-1790]. Applications that decrypt or parse PKCS#7 data from untrusted sources are affected. OpenSSL clients and servers are not affected. The impact was not specified.

Michal Zalewski of Google reported this vulnerability on April 18, 2015.

A remote user can create a specially crafted signedData message that specifies an unknown hash function OID to trigger an infinite loop in the CMS code [CVE-2015-1792]. Applications that verify signedData messages using the CMS code are affected.

Johannes Bauer reported this vulnerability on March 31, 2015.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target application to crash or enter an infinite loop.

A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The impact of one vulnerability was not disclosed.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2014-8176, CVE-2015-1788, CVE-2015-1789, CVE-2015-1790, and CVE-2015-1792 for Palo Alto PAN-OS.

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/61

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSL Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service and Decrypt TLS Sessions in Certain Cases
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases by using a server that supports SSLv2 and EXPORT cipher suites as a Bleichenbacher RSA padding oracle [CVE-2016-0800]. This attack is known as a DROWN attack.

Systems with a private key used on another server for any protocol that allows SSLv2 connections are affected.

Systems running versions prior to 1.0.2a, 1.0.1m, 1.0.0r, and 0.9.8zf (released on March 19, 2015) can be exploited more readily.

The original advisory is available at:

https://drownattack.com/drown-attack-paper.pdf

Nimrod Aviram, Sebastian Schinzel, Juraj Somorovsky, Nadia Heninger, Maik Dankel, Jens Steube, Luke Valenta, David Adrian, J. Alex Halderman, Viktor Dukhovni, Emilia Kasper, Shaanan Cohney, Susanne Engels, Christof Paar, and Yuval Shavitt reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted private DSA key that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a double free memory error and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2016-0705].

Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted username value to the target SRP server to trigger a memory leak [CVE-2016-0798].

Emilia Kasper of the OpenSSL development team reported this vulnerability.

A user can create specially crafted data (e.g., configuration file) that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a null pointer dereference in the BN_hex2bn/BN_dec2bn() functions [CVE-2016-0797].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A user can create specially crafted data that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a memory error in BIO_*printf() functions [CVE-2016-0799].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A local user can conduct a side-channel attack against a system based on the Intel Sandy-Bridge microarchitecture to potentially recover RSA keys [CVE-2016-0702].

Yuval Yarom, the University of Adelaide and NICTA, Daniel Genkin, Technion and Tel Aviv University, and Nadia Heninger, University of Pennsylvania, reported this vulnerability.

The SSLv2 's2_srvr.c' code does not ensure that a clear-key-length value is 0 for non-export ciphers. As a result, clear-key bytes can displace encrypted-key bytes, which can be exploited to conduct a key recovery attack [CVE-2016-0703].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

The Bleichenbacher protection for export cipher suites in 's2_srvr.c' overwrites bytes incorrectly in the master-key, which may provide a Bleichenbacher oracle that can be used to decrypt sessions [CVE-2016-0704].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and all prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory write error in doapr_outch() in 'crypto/bio/b_print.c' to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2016-2842].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2016-0703, CVE-2016-0704, and CVE-2016-0800 for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.0.15, 6.1.12).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/63

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Unspecified Flaw Permits JavaScript Execution Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can conduct JavaScript execution attacks.
A remote authenticated user can apply an incorrect web management server configuration to cause JavaScript execution. The impact was not specified.

ringzero reported this vulnerability.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.13, 7.0.8).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/62

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Monitor Tab Lets Remote Authenticated Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The management web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the monitor tab before displaying the input. A remote authenticated user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Juan Sacco, Exploit Pack, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.20, 5.1.13, 6.0.15, 6.1.14, 7.0.10, 7.1.5).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/64

Title: Cisco ASA 5500-X Series with FirePOWER Services Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Snort Service to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target service to restart. A remote user can bypass Snort detection.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target Snort process to restart. This can be exploited to bypass Snort detection while the process is restarting.

5500-X Series ASA devices with FirePOWER Services are affected if the ASA release supports the command-line interface (CLI) command 'sfr fail-open' and that command is configured.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux61630 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Snort service to restart, bypassing Snort detection while the service restarts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161019-fpsnort

Title: Cisco ASA Local Certificate Authority Enrollment Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted enrollment request to the target system via HTTPS to trigger a flaw in the Certificate Authority (CA) enrollment feature and cause the target system to reload.

Systems configured in routed firewall mode and in single or multiple context mode are affected. 

Systems with the local CA feature configured are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz47295 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.0(4.42), 9.1(7.7), 9.2(4.13), 9.3(3.11), 9.4(3.6), 9.5(3), 9.6(1.5)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161019-asa-ca

Title: Cisco ASA Buffer Overflow in Identity Firewall Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can return a specially crafted NetBIOS packet via IPv4 in response to a NetBIOS probe sent by the target system to trigger a buffer overflow in the Identity Firewall feature and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Systems configured in routed and transparent firewall mode and in single or multiple context mode are affected.

The following models are affected:

ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
ASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls
Catalyst 6500 Series/7600 Series ASA Services Module
ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall
Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)
ASA for Firepower 9300 Series
ASA for Firepower 4100 Series
ISA 3000 Industrial Security Appliance

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb19843 to this vulnerability.

Slipper and Kelwin (@KelwinYang) from Chaitin Technology Co., Ltd., reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161019-asa-idfw

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Range Header Null Pointer Dereference Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted HTTP Range Header value to trigger a null pointer dereference in the target web service.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target web service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.1.13).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/60

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS GlobalProtect Portal Web Interface Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can connect to the GlobalProtect Portal web interface to determine the PAN-OS version number.

Mikail Tunc reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine the PAN-OS version number.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.10, 7.1.5).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/59

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) Linux Kernel UDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Linux Kernel. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote user can send a flood of UDP packets with specially crafted checksums to cause the target application to hang [CVE-2015-5364].

A remote user can send a flood of UDP packets with specially crafted checksums to cause the target application to stop reading packets [CVE-2015-5366].
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target application to hang.

A remote user can cause the target application to stop reading packets.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2015-5364 and CVE-2015-5366 for Palo Alto PAN-OS (7.1.5).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/58

Title: Cisco ASA DHCP Relay Resource Handling Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted DHCP packets at specific rates to the target system to trigger a resource handling flaw and cause the target interface to become wedged and stop processing incoming traffic. A reload is required to return the interface to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy66942 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target interface to stop processing incoming traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161005-asa-dhcp

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco PIX Firewall) Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR IKEv1 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Memory Contents on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR. A remote user can obtain memory contents on the target system. Cisco PIX Firewall is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted IKEv1 packets via IPv4 or IPv6 to the IKE service on the target device to obtain memory contents from the target device.

The IKE service may run on UDP ports 500, 848, 4500, or 4848.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is similar to the BENIGNCERTAIN vulnerability reported by Shadow Brokers.]

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvb29204 and CSCvb36055 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain memory contents on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco PIX version 7.x is affected.

Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160916-ikev1

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall IKE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Encryption Keys on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall. A remote user can obtain keys on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted Internet Key Exchange (IKE) packets to the target system to trigger a memory access error and obtain portions of system memory from the target system, which may contain VPN pre-shared keys.

A tool named 'BENIGNCERTAIN' that exploits this vulnerability is publicly available.

Shadow Brokers reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain VPN pre-shared keys on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Version 7.0 and later versions are not affected.

[Editor's note: The Cisco PIX firewall is no longer supported by the vendor.]

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://blogs.cisco.com/security/shadow-brokers

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) Glibc getaddrinfo() Stack Overflow Lets Remote or Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 5.0.X, 5.1.X, 6.0.X, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.7 and prior, 7.1.3 and prior
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow in the getaddrinfo() function in the glibc DNS client resolver code ('resolv/nss_dns') and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application using the glibc library.

Various applications may be affected, including ssh, sudo, and curl.

Additional information is available at:

https://googleonlinesecurity.blogspot.com/2016/02/cve-2015-7547-glibc-getaddrinfo-stack.html
Impact': A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.1.13, 7.0.8, 7.1.4).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/54

A remote user can create a specially crafted private DSA key that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a double free memory error and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2016-0705].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A local user can conduct a side-channel attack against a system based on the Intel Sandy-Bridge microarchitecture to potentially recover RSA keys [CVE-2016-0702].

Yuval Yarom, the University of Adelaide and NICTA, Daniel Genkin, Technion and Tel Aviv University, and Nadia Heninger, University of Pennsylvania, reported this vulnerability.

The SSLv2 's2_srvr.c' code does not ensure that a clear-key-length value is 0 for non-export ciphers. As a result, clear-key bytes can displace encrypted-key bytes, which can be exploited to conduct a key recovery attack [CVE-2016-0703].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

The Bleichenbacher protection for export cipher suites in 's2_srvr.c' overwrites bytes incorrectly in the master-key, which may provide a Bleichenbacher oracle that can be used to decrypt sessions [CVE-2016-0704].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and all prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory write error in doapr_outch() in 'crypto/bio/b_print.c' to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2016-2842].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2016-2842 for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.0.14, 6.1.13, 7.0.9, 7.1.4).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/53

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Decrypt Data, Deny Service, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 5.0.X, 5.1.X, 6.0.13 and prior, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.8 and prior, 7.1.3 and prior
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can decrypt data in certain cases. A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target application using OpenSSL. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can conduct a padding oracle attack against data encrypted with an AES CBC cipher when the target server supports AES-NI to decrypt the data [CVE-2016-2107].

[Editor's note: This vulnerability was introduced in fix for a previous vulnerability known as the Lucky 13 padding attack (CVE-2013-0169).]

Juraj Somorovsky reported this vulnerability.

A remote or local user can supply specially crafted data to trigger an overflow in the EVP_EncodeUpdate() function and cause a heap corruption and cause the target application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2016-2105]. Applications that call the affected PEM_write_bio* functions may be affected.

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A remote or local user can supply specially crafted data to trigger an overflow in the EVP_EncryptUpdate() function and cause a heap corruption and cause the target application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2016-2106]. Applications that call the affected function may be affected.

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A remote or local user can supply specially crafted ASN.1 data to an application that reads data from a BIO using functions such as d2i_CMS_bio() to trigger a memory allocation error and consume excessive memory on the target system [CVE-2016-2109]. TLS applications are not affected.

Brian Carpenter reported this vulnerability.

An application can supply a specially crafted ASN.1 string longer than 1024 bytes to the X509_NAME_oneline() function on EBCDIC systems to trigger a memory over-read and return arbitrary stack data containing potentially sensitive information [CVE-2016-2176].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can decrypt traffic in certain cases.

A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target application that uses OpenSSL.

A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.0.14, 6.1.13, 7.0.9, 7.1.4).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/53

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Version(s): 5.0.X, 5.1.X, 6.0.13 and prior, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.8 and prior, 7.1.3 and prior
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote server can send a specially crafted ServerKeyExchange for an anonymous DH ciphersuite with the value of p set to 0 to potentially cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-1794]. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 3, 2015.

Guy Leaver (Cisco) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a carry propagation flaw in BN_mod_exp() to potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations [CVE-2015-3193].

Systems configured for persistent DH parameters and sharing a private key between multiple clients are affected. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 13, 2015.

Hanno Bock reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a certificate with a specially crafted ASN.1 signature that uses the RSA PSS algorithm and does not contain the mast generation function parameter to trigger a null pointer dereference and crash [CVE-2015-3194]. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

The vendor was notified on August 27 2015.

Loic Jonas Etienne (Qnective AG) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted X509_ATTRIBUTE structure to trigger a memory leak and potentially disclose sensitive information [CVE-2015-3195]. Applications that read PKCS#7 or CMS data from untrusted sources are affected. SSL/TLS is not affected.

The vendor was notified on November 9, 2015.

Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send send PSK identity hints to a multi-threaded client to trigger a race condition and then a double free memory error and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-3196]. Versions 1.0.0, 1.0.1 (prior to 1.0.1p), and 1.0.2 (prior to 1.0.2d) are affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2015-1794 and CVE-2015-3195 for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.0.14, 6.1.13, 7.0.9, 7.1.4).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/53

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSL Double Free Memory Error in ssl3_get_new_session_ticket() Has Unspecified Impact
Version(s): 5.0.X, 5.1.X, 6.0.13 and prior, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.8 and prior, 7.1.3 and prior
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. The impact was not specified. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote server can return a specially crafted NewSessionTicket message to a connected multi-threaded client to cause the client to attempt to reuse a previous ticket and trigger a race condition. As a result, a double free memory error may occur in ssl3_get_new_session_ticket().

Emilia Kasper of the OpenSSL development team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.0.14, 6.1.13, 7.0.9, 7.1.4).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/53

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 5.0.X, 5.1.X, 6.0.13 and prior, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.8 and prior, 7.1.3 and prior
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted application data to a connected DTLS peer between the ChangeCipherSpec and Finished messages to trigger an invalid memory free and cause a segmentation fault or memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-8176]. Versions 0.9.8 prior to 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 prior to 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 prior to 1.0.1h are affected.

Praveen Kariyanahalli and Ivan Fratric and Felix Groebert of Google separately reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted ECParameters to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2015-1788]. Applications that process public keys, certificate requests, or certificates are affected. TLS clients and TLS servers with client authentication enabled are affected. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

Joseph Birr-Pixton reported this vulnerability on April 6, 2015.

A remote user can create a specially crafted certificate or certificate revocation list (CRL) that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an out-of-bound memory read in X509_cmp_time() and cause a segmentation fault [CVE-2015-1789]. TLS clients that verify CRLs are affected. TLS clients and servers with client authentication enabled and that use custom verification callbacks may be affected.

Robert Swiecki of Google reported this vulnerability on April 8, 2015 and Hanno Bock independently reported this vulnerability on April 11, 2015.

A remote user can create specially crafted ASN.1-encoded PKCS#7 data with a missing EnvelopedContent component to trigger a null pointer dereference [CVE-2015-1790]. Applications that decrypt or parse PKCS#7 data from untrusted sources are affected. OpenSSL clients and servers are not affected. The impact was not specified.

Michal Zalewski of Google reported this vulnerability on April 18, 2015.

A remote user can create a specially crafted signedData message that specifies an unknown hash function OID to trigger an infinite loop in the CMS code [CVE-2015-1792]. Applications that verify signedData messages using the CMS code are affected.

Johannes Bauer reported this vulnerability on March 31, 2015.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target application to crash or enter an infinite loop.

A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The impact of one vulnerability was not disclosed.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2014-8176, CVE-2015-1788, CVE-2015-1789, CVE-2015-1790, and CVE-2015-1792 for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.0.14, 6.1.13, 7.0.9, 7.1.4).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/53

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Spoof Messages, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Deny Service
Version(s): 5.0.X, 5.1.X, 6.0.X, 6.1.12 and prior, 7.0.8 and prior, 7.1.3 and prior
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can impersonate ntp peers. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
A remote user can conduct a replay attack against authenticated broadcast mode packets [CVE-2015-7973].

A remote authenticated user can exploit a key check flaw to impersonate a peer [CVE-2015-7974].

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the nextvar() function in ntpq and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-7975].

A remote authenticated user can send an ntpq saveconfig command with specially crafted filename characters to cause unintended results [CVE-2015-7976].

A remote user can send a specially crafted ntpdc reslist command to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-7977].

A remote user can send a specially crafted reslist command to consume all available stack memory [CVE-2015-7978].

A remote user can send a specially crafted broadcast mode packet to cause the target broadcast client to tear down the association with the broadcast server [CVE-2015-7979].

A remote server can send a specially crafted packet with an origin timestamp of zero to bypass the timestamp validation check in certain cases [CVE-2015-8138].

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an infinite loop in ntpq [CVE-2015-8158].

A remote user can trigger an origin leak in ntpq and ntpdc to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2015-8139].

A remote user on the local network may be able to conduct replay attacks against ntpq [CVE-2015-8140].

Cisco ASIG reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can impersonate an ntp peer.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2015-7973, CVE-2015-7974, CVE-2015-7975, CVE-2015-7976, CVE-2015-7977, CVE-2015-7978, CVE-2015-7979, CVE-2015-8138, and CVE-2015-8158 for Palo Alto PAN-OS (6.1.13, 7.0.9, 7.1.4).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/52

Title: Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS Buffer Overflow in Cookie Parser Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 4.1.10 and prior, 4.2.12 and prior, 4.3.8 and prior
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to trigger a buffer overflow in the cookie parser and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Firmware versions 4.x released prior to August 2012 are affected.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system to gain administrative control.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.1.11, 4.2.13 ,4.3.9).

Version 5.x is not affected.

The vendor advisory is available at:

Title: Cisco ASA 5500-X Series with FirePOWER Services Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA 5500-X Series with FirePOWER Services. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted HTTP requests to the web interface to trigger an access control flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur25513 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.3.1.2, 5.4.0.1, 5.4.1, 6.0.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160817-fmc

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco PIX Firewall) Cisco ASA SNMP Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload or execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco PIX Firewall is affected.
A remote user with knowledge of the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) community string can send specially crafted SNMP packets via IPv4 to the target system to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target system to reload or execute arbitrary code.

The following hardware devices may also be affected when running ASA software:

Cisco ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers
Cisco ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall
Cisco Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)
Cisco Firepower 9300 ASA Security Module
Cisco PIX Firewalls
Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM)

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva92151 to this vulnerability.

Shadow Brokers reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target system to reload.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for Cisco PIX Firewall.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160817-asa-snmp

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco PIX Firewall) Cisco ASA Command Line Interface Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A local user can cause denial of service conditions or obtain root privileges on the target system. Cisco PIX Firewall is affected.
A local user can supply specially crafted commands to trigger a flaw in the command-line interface (CLI) parser and cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The following hardware devices may also be affected when running ASA software:

Cisco PIX Firewalls
Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM)

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtu74257 to this vulnerability.

Shadow Brokers reported this vulnerability.
Impact':

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS 'cron' Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit an input validation flaw in the use of 'cron' to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

Felix Wilhelm, ERNW Research, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.19, 5.1.12, 6.0.14, 6.1.12, 7.0.7, 7.1.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/47

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in root_reboot Lets Local Users Obtain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke the root_reboot utility to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

Kasif Dekel, CheckPoint Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.19, 5.1.12, 6.0.14, 6.1.12, 7.0.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/45

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Travis Christianson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.19, 5.1.12, 6.0.14, 6.1.12, 7.0.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/47

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Unspecified Flaw in Captive Portal Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can trigger an unspecified flaw in the Captive Portal component to temporarily disrupt the target portal's operation.

Felix Wilhelm, ERNW Research, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.19, 6.0.14, 6.1.12, 7.0.7, 7.1.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/46

Title: (Palo Alto Networks Issues Fix for Palo Alto PAN-OS) OpenSSH Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information From Client Memory
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSH. A remote authenticated server can obtain potentially sensitive information from OpenSSH client memory on the target system or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target client system. Palo Alto PAN-OS is affected.
An OpenSSH server on an authenticated connection can cause the connected client to leak portions of client memory to the server [CVE-2016-0777]. This may include private client user keys.

The Qualys Security team reported this vulnerability.

An OpenSSH server on an authenticated connection may be able to trigger a buffer overflow and file descriptor leak in the connected client in certain cases when using ProxyCommand, ForwardAgent, or ForwardX11 [CVE-2016-0778].

The Qualys Security team reported this vulnerability.

A user may be able to trigger an out-of-bounds read access error in the packet handling code [CVE-2016-1907]. Ben Hawkes reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated server can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target connected client.
Solution:
Palo Alto Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2016-0777 and CVE-2016-0778 for Palo Alto PAN-OS (7.1.3).

The Palo Alto Networks advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/44

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS CLI Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user with command line interface (CLI) access and read-only privileges can exploit an unspecified flaw and impersonate another user to gain elevated privileges on the target web interface.

The Boeing Company reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.19, 5.1.12, 6.0.14, 6.1.11, 7.0.5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/49

Title: Cisco ASA Bug in ICMP Message Processing Lets Remote Users Bypass the Access Control List
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can bypass the ICMP permit and deny filters to send ICMP Echo Request and ICMP Echo Reply messages through the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy25163 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the ICMP filters to access hosts or resources on the protected network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160711-asa

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS Input Validation Flaw in Web Interface Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target authenticated user's browser. The code will originate from the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Roman Zaikin, CheckPoint Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target authenticated user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Palo Alto PAN-OS interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/42

Title: Palo Alto PAN-OS API Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palo Alto PAN-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the configuration API inteface to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.

Tenable Network Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/Home/Detail/41

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco ASA) ntp Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Modify Parameters and Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can modify configuration parameters in certain cases. Cisco ASA is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted spoofed packet containing an invalid MAC to the target system to demobilize its ephemeral association [CVE-2016-4953].

A remote user can send specially crafted spoofed packets to bypass some validation checks in the receive() function and be processed by the process_packet() function in 'ntp_proto.c' [CVE-2016-4954]. In some cases, the remote user may be able to modify certain peer variables on the target system.

A remote user can send a specially crafted spoofed packet with an invalid MAC or crypto-NAK to the target system to reset its association and potentially prevent the association from working [CVE-2016-4955]. Systems using autokey for authentication are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause a target broadcast client to switch to interleave mode and cause the client synchronization to become disabled [CVE-2016-4956].

A remote user can send a specially crafted crypto-NAK packet to the target system to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the ntpd process to crash [CVE-2016-4957].

Jakub Prokes of Red Hat Quality Engineering, Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat, and Nicolas Edet of Cisco reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can modify configuration parameters in certain cases.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions, including crashing the daemon, destabilizing ephemeral associations, and disabling synchronization.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issue a fix (9.3.4.6; 1-Aug-2016).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160603-ntpd

Title: Cisco ASA XML Parser Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated administrative user can upload a specially crafted XML file to trigger a flaw in the XML parser and cause the system to become unstable or reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut14209 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1(7.6), 9.2(4.8), 9.3(3.8), 9.4(2.6), 9.5(2.6)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160517-asa-xml

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco ASA Next-Generation Firewall Services) OpenSSL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Decrypt Data, Deny Service, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can decrypt data in certain cases. A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target application using OpenSSL. Cisco ASA Next-Generation Firewall Services is affected.
A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can conduct a padding oracle attack against data encrypted with an AES CBC cipher when the target server supports AES-NI to decrypt the data [CVE-2016-2107].

[Editor's note: This vulnerability was introduced in fix for a previous vulnerability known as the Lucky 13 padding attack (CVE-2013-0169).]

Juraj Somorovsky reported this vulnerability.

A remote or local user can supply specially crafted data to trigger an overflow in the EVP_EncodeUpdate() function and cause a heap corruption and cause the target application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2016-2105]. Applications that call the affected PEM_write_bio* functions may be affected.

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A remote or local user can supply specially crafted data to trigger an overflow in the EVP_EncryptUpdate() function and cause a heap corruption and cause the target application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2016-2106]. Applications that call the affected function may be affected.

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A remote or local user can supply specially crafted ASN.1 data to an application that reads data from a BIO using functions such as d2i_CMS_bio() to trigger a memory allocation error and consume excessive memory on the target system [CVE-2016-2109]. TLS applications are not affected.

Brian Carpenter reported this vulnerability.

An application can supply a specially crafted ASN.1 string longer than 1024 bytes to the X509_NAME_oneline() function on EBCDIC systems to trigger a memory over-read and return arbitrary stack data containing potentially sensitive information [CVE-2016-2176].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can decrypt traffic in certain cases.

A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target application that uses OpenSSL.

A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry for Cisco ASA Next-Generation Firewall Services.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160504-openssl

Title: Cisco ASA Logging Flaw in FirePOWER Services Kernel Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA with the Cisco FirePOWER module. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a flood of specially crafted IP packets to the target device to consume excessive system resources and cause the target Cisco FirePOWER module to stop inspecting traffic or to go offline.

The kernel logging configuration for the Firepower System Software for the Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) 5585-X FirePOWER Security Services Processor (SSP) module is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux19922 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Cisco FirePOWER module to stop inspecting traffic or to go offline.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160504-fpkern

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco ASA) ntp Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Spoof Messages, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, Modify Time, and Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote or remote authenticated user can modify time on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. Cisco ASA is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted crypto-NAK packets with a spoofed source address of an existing peer to trigger an error in 'ntp_proto.c' and cause the preemptable client association to be demobilized [CVE-2016-1547].

A remote user can send a spoofed packet with a specially crafted timestamp to cause the target ntpd client to reject future server responses from the spoofed server. As a result, the remote user can modify the time of the target client or cause denial of service conditions on the target client [CVE-2016-1548].

A remote authenticated peer can create an arbitrary number of ephemeral associations to modify the time on the target system [CVE-2016-1549].

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted messages to potentially recover the message digest key [CVE-2016-1550].

A remote user can send specially crafted spoofed packets to a target system that fails to implement martian packet filtering to modify the time on the target system [CVE-2016-1551].

A remote user with knowledge of the controlkey (for ntpq) or the requestkey (for ntpdc) can create a specially crafted session to cause ntpd to crash in certain cases [CVE-2016-2516].

A remote authenticated user with knowledge of the of the controlkey (for ntpq) or the requestkey (for ntpdc) can create a specially crafted session to prevent ntpd from processing authentication requests until the process is restarted [CVE-2016-2517].

A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to trigger an out-of-bounds memory reference error in the MATCH_ASSOC() function when creating a peer association with hmode > 7 [CVE-2016-2518].

A remote authenticated user can cause a specially crafted data value to be stored by ntpd and then cause ntpd to crash when attempting to read the value via ctl_getitem() [CVE-2016-2519].

Matt Street, Matthew Van Gundy, Stephen Gray, Jonathan Gardner, and others of Cisco ASIG, Yihan Lian (of the Cloud Security Team, Qihoo 360), Miroslav Lichvar of RedHat, Michael Tatarinov (NTP Project Developer Volunteer), and Loganaden Velvindron reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote or remote authenticated user can modify time on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry. The vendor plans to issue a fix (9.3.4.4) on August 1, 2016.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160428-ntpd

Title: Juniper ScreenOS SSL/TLS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper ScreenOS. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SSL/TLS packet to the target administrative web services interface to prevent administrative access and potentially cause the target system to reboot.

The SSH administrative port is not affected.

SSL/TLS traffic sent through the target device does not trigger this vulnerability.

The vendor has assigned PR 1123333 to this vulnerability.

Marcel Bilal reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target administrative web interface to become unavailable and potentially cause the target system to reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.3.0r21).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10732

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in libSRTP Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to restart.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Secure Real-Time Transport Protocol (SRTP) packet to trigger an integer underflow in the encryption processing subsystem of the SRTP library (libSRTP) and cause the target system to restart.

Systems configured with the deprecated Phone Proxy feature are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux00686 to this vulnerability.

Other Cisco products are affected.

Randell Jesup with the Mozilla team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.4.7.31, 9.1.7, 9.2.4.6, 9.3.3.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160420-libsrtp

Title: Cisco ASA DHCPv6 Relay Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted DHCPv6 packets to the target device to trigger a flaw in the DHCPv6 relay feature and cause the target device to reload.

Systems configured in routed firewall mode and in single or multiple context mode are affected when configured with the DHCPv6 relay feature.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus23248 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.4(1.1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160420-asa-dhcpv6

Title: Cisco ASA FirePOWER Services Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Malware Detection on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA FirePOWER Services. A remote user can bypass malware detection.
A remote user can supply specially crafted HTTP header values to the target system to trigger an input validation flaw in the malicious file detection and blocking features and bypass malware detection on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux22726 to this vulnerability.

Dikla Barda, Liad Mizrachi, and Oded Vanunu of the Check Point Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass malware detection.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (FirePOWER 5.4.0.7, 5.4.1.6, 6.0.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160330-fp

Title: WatchGuard Fireware XTM Open Redirect Flaw Lets Remote Users Redirect the Target User's Browser to an Arbitrary Site
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in WatchGuard Fireware XTM. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site.
A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit an input validation flaw in the management Web UI authentication form and redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]:8080/auth/login?username=test&from_page=https://[attacker]/&domain=&password=\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Windows\system.ini

The vendor was notified on December 15, 2016.

Manuel Mancera (@sinkmanu) of www.a2secure.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.10.7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.watchguard.com/support/release-notes/fireware/11/en-US/#Fireware/en-US/resolved_issues.html?TocPath=_____11

Title: Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Open Redirect and Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http[s]://[target]/login?redir=http[:]//[redirect site]

The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'redir' parameter is affected.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http[s]://[target]/login?redir=javascript:alert(document.cookie)

Javier Nieto from www.behindthefirewalls.com reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.13, 5.2.3, 5.4.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.fortiguard.com/advisory/fortios-open-redirect-vulnerability

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper ScreenOS) OpenSSL Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service and Decrypt TLS Sessions in Certain Cases
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. Juniper ScreenOS is affected.
A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases by using a server that supports SSLv2 and EXPORT cipher suites as a Bleichenbacher RSA padding oracle [CVE-2016-0800]. This attack is known as a DROWN attack.

Systems with a private key used on another server for any protocol that allows SSLv2 connections are affected.

Systems running versions prior to 1.0.2a, 1.0.1m, 1.0.0r, and 0.9.8zf (released on March 19, 2015) can be exploited more readily.

The original advisory is available at:

https://drownattack.com/drown-attack-paper.pdf

Nimrod Aviram, Sebastian Schinzel, Juraj Somorovsky, Nadia Heninger, Maik Dankel, Jens Steube, Luke Valenta, David Adrian, J. Alex Halderman, Viktor Dukhovni, Emilia Kasper, Shaanan Cohney, Susanne Engels, Christof Paar, and Yuval Shavitt reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted private DSA key that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a double free memory error and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2016-0705].

Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted username value to the target SRP server to trigger a memory leak [CVE-2016-0798].

Emilia Kasper of the OpenSSL development team reported this vulnerability.

A user can create specially crafted data (e.g., configuration file) that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a null pointer dereference in the BN_hex2bn/BN_dec2bn() functions [CVE-2016-0797].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A user can create specially crafted data that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a memory error in BIO_*printf() functions [CVE-2016-0799].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A local user can conduct a side-channel attack against a system based on the Intel Sandy-Bridge microarchitecture to potentially recover RSA keys [CVE-2016-0702].

Yuval Yarom, the University of Adelaide and NICTA, Daniel Genkin, Technion and Tel Aviv University, and Nadia Heninger, University of Pennsylvania, reported this vulnerability.

The SSLv2 's2_srvr.c' code does not ensure that a clear-key-length value is 0 for non-export ciphers. As a result, clear-key bytes can displace encrypted-key bytes, which can be exploited to conduct a key recovery attack [CVE-2016-0703].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

The Bleichenbacher protection for export cipher suites in 's2_srvr.c' overwrites bytes incorrectly in the master-key, which may provide a Bleichenbacher oracle that can be used to decrypt sessions [CVE-2016-0704].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and all prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory write error in doapr_outch() in 'crypto/bio/b_print.c' to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2016-2842].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor notes that with ScreenOS 6.3.0r19 (and later), SSLv2 and SSLv3 can be manually disabled via the 'unset ssl ssl3' CLI command.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10722

Title: Cisco ASA Content Security and Control Security Services Module HTTPS Packet Processing Error Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Version(s): 5500 Series CSC-SSM devices; 6.6.x prior to 6.6.1164.0; 6.6.x without hotfix 1157
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
The Content Security and Control Security Services Module (CSC-SSM) does not properly process HTTPS packets transiting the device. A remote user can send HTTPS packets through the target device at a high rate to consume all available memory on the target device. As a result, the device will become unstable and reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue76147 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system and cause the system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160309-csc

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in VPN Portal Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The VPN portal password recovery form does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the username field before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco ASA software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor was notified on February 4, 2016.

Juan Sacco of exploitpack.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco ASA VPN portal site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

Title: Cisco ASA Buffer Overflow in IKEv1/IKEv2 Processing Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets via IPv4 or IPv6 to the target system to trigger a buffer overflow in the IKEv1 and IKEv2 processing code and cause the target system to reload or execute arbitrary code.

Systems configured to terminate IKEv1 or IKEv2 VPN connections are affected.

Systems configured in routed firewall mode and in either single or multiple context mode are affected.

Clientless SSL and AnyConnect SSL configurations are not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCux29978 and CSCux42019 to this vulnerability.

A demonstration exploit method is described at:

https://blog.exodusintel.com/2016/02/10/firewall-hacking/

David Barksdale, Jordan Gruskovnjak, and Alex Wheeler of Exodus Intelligence reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.4(7.30), 8.7(1.18), 9.0(4.38), 9.1(7), 9.2(4.5), 9.3(3.7), 9.4(2.4), 9.5(2.2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160210-asa-ike

Title: Cisco ASA RBAC Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Modify Passwords on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can modify passwords on the target system.
