Nick Hayes of Portcullis Computer Security Limited reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication to gain access to the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco ASA WebVPN CIFS Boundary Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a bounds checking flaw in the WebVPN Common Internet File System (CIFS) access function to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj83344 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6691

Title: Juniper ScreenOS SSL/TLS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper ScreenOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SSL/TLS packet to cause the target device to crash.

If the target device is using a HA configuration, a failover will occur.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.3.0r17).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10624

Title: Cisco ASA Inspection and Filtering Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the inspection and filter functions and cause the target device to reload.

A received packet that is matched for both filtering and inspection when a configuration has overlapping traffic matching criteria can trigger this flaw.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui45606 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5567

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in WebVPN Interface Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Javascript file that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will obtain potentially sensitive information from the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui04520 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2151

Title: Cisco ASA Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
On systems with the HTTP server enabled, a remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted URL to access information stored on the file system of the target system, including the configuration file.

On systems configured in multiple context mode, only a remote authenticated admin user can exploit the flaw.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun78551 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including the system configuration.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2181

Title: Cisco ASA DHCPv6 Replay Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted DHCP version 6 (DHCPv6) packets to cause the target system to reload.

Systems with the DHCPv6 replay feature enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun45520 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2182

Title: (WatchGuard Issues Fix for WatchGuard XTM) OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. WatchGuard XTM is affected.
A remote client or server can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vulnerability was introduced to the source code in December 2011 and to release version 1.0.1 in March 2012.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
WatchGuard has issued a fix for WatchGuard XTM (11.8.3 Update 1).

Encryption keys used with vulnerable versions may have been compromised and should be replaced.

Versions 11.7.4 and prior are not affected.

The WatchGuard advisory is available at:

http://watchguardsecuritycenter.com/2014/04/09/11-8-3-update-1-now-available-to-fix-heartbleed-vulnerabilty-in-fireware-xtm-os/

Title: Cisco ASA Bugs Let Remote Users Access the Internal Network or Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can gain access to the internal network.
A remote authenticated user with privilege level 0 can exploit a flaw in the Cisco Adaptive Security Device Manager (ASDM) to gain administrative access on the target system [CVE-2014-2126].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj33496 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated Clientless SSL VPN portal user can submit specially crafted URLs to gain administrative privileges on the target system [CVE-2014-2127].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul70099 to this vulnerability.

Jonathan Claudius from Trustwave SpiderLabs and Laura Guay from Dell SecureWorks reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL or modify the HTTP POST body with a specially crafted cookie value to exploit a flaw in the processing of authentication cookies to gain access to the SSL VPN Portal page, start a VPN tunnel, and gain access to the internal network [CVE-2014-2128].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCua85555 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted packets through the SIP inspection engine to consume all available memory and cause the system to become unstable or reload [CVE-2014-2129].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh44052 to this vulnerability.

Systems configured in routed and transparent firewall mode and single or multiple context mode are affected by this denial of service vulnerability.

The following models are affected by these vulnerabilities:

Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
Cisco ASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls
Cisco ASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers
Cisco ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can gain elevate privileges on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can gain access to the internal network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2(5.48), 8.3(2.40), 8.4(7.15), 8.6(1.13), 8.7(1.11), 9.0(4.1), 9.1(4.5)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140409-asa

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Hole in WebVPN Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The WebVPN login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco ASA WebVPN interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun19025 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco ASA WebVPN interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2120

Title: WatchGuard Fireware XTM Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in WatchGuard Fireware XTM. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Fireware XTM web user interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target administrative user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the WatchGuard Fireware XTM web user interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

William Costa reported this vulnerability via US-CERT.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WatchGuard Fireware XTM web user interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.8.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://watchguardsecuritycenter.com/2014/03/13/fireware-xtm-11-8-3-update-corrects-xss-flaw/

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module Flaw in Cut-Through Proxy Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a memory allocation race condition in the cut-through proxy and cause the target device to reload. Data that matches the condition that triggers cut-through proxy authentication can trigger this condition.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj16824 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2(28), 4.1(15)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140219-fwsm

Title: (McAfee Issues Advisory for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) OpenSSL AES-NI and Invalid OCSP Key Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected by one vulnerability.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to a system using AES-NI for TLS 1.2 or TLS 1.1 to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2012-2686]. Only version 1.0.1c is affected.

Adam Langley and Wolfgang Ettlingers separately reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit an invalid key flaw in the handling of OCSP response verification to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2013-0166].

Stephen Henson of the OpenSSL core team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
McAfee has issued an advisory for CVE-2013-0166 for McAfee Firewall Enterprise.

Version 7.0.1.03 is affected. A patch is not yet available for this version.

Version 8.2.1 and later are not affected.

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB81224

Title: Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The '/firewall/schedule/recurrdlg' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'mkey' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the FortiGate interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

William Costa reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the FortiGate interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.fortiguard.com/advisory/FG-IR-14-003/

Title: Cisco ASA RADIUS Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the Identity Firewall Cache
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can modify the Identity Firewall cache.
A remote user can replay RADIUS Change of Authorization (CoA) messages to modify the contents of the Identity Firewall (IDFW) user cache.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45332 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the Identity Firewall user cache.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0655

Title: Cisco ASA Identity Firewall NetBIOS Logout Probe Response Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Access Status
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can affect the integrity of a target user's access.
The system does not properly validate NetBIOS probe responses. A remote user can send a specially crafted NetBIOS probe response to exploit a flaw in the Identity Firewall feature and impact the authorization status of users authorized via the Identity Firewall feature.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj45340 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can affect the integrity of a target user's access.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0653

Title: Juniper NetScreen ScreenOS Ping Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper NetScreen ScreenOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When the 'Ping of Death' screen is not enabled, a remote user can send specially crafted packets to cause denial of service conditions on the target device.

Shuichiro Suzuki of FFRI, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.3.0.r16, pending).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10604

Title: Cisco ASA Memory Leak in Connection Manager Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted management session requests to trigger a memory leak in the connection manager code when management flows are created to cause the target system to become unresponsive to management session requests via SSH, Telnet, HTTP, and HTTPS.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug33233 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the system to become unresponsive to management session requests via SSH, Telnet, HTTP, and HTTPS.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6707

Title: Cisco ASA DNS Reply Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote DNS server can send a specially crafted DNS reply packet to cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj28861 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6696

Title: Cisco ASA Certificate Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the Proxy Connection Database
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can modify the phone proxy connection database.
The system does not properly validate certificates. A remote user can use a specially crafted certificate to temporarily insert an invalid entry in the phone proxy connection database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui33299 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the phone proxy connection database.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6682

Title: Cisco ASA IPv6 NAT Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets through a system configured for NAT64 or NAT66 to cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue34342 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5560

Title: Cisco ASA Bug in Auto-Update Feature Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the auto-update function to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui33308 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5568

Title: Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can load a specially crafted URL via the SSL VPN portal to trigger a stack overflow and cause the system to reload.

The flaw can be triggered by browsing internal resources via the clientless SSL VPN portal when the same-security-traffic permit intra-interface and management-access commands are configured.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui51199 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5551

Title: Cisco ASA CX Safe Search Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Policy
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can bypass security policy.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP packet to bypass the Safe Search security policy filter.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui94622 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the Safe Search component security policy.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5561

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) FreeBSD Kernel nullfs(5) Cross-Mount Links May Let Local Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A local user can bypass filesystem access controls in certain cases. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
A local user with read access to a nullfs view and write access to a different nullfs view into the same filesystem can create a hard link from the read-only view to the other view to be able to gain write access on an ostensibly read-only file system.

Konstantin Belousov reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass filesystem access controls in certain cases.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (8.3.1P04).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB79597

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) FreeBSD Network ioctl(2) Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
A local user can cause any network interface in the system to perform the link layer actions associated with a SIOCSIFADDR, SIOCSIFBRDADDR, SIOCSIFDSTADDR or SIOCSIFNETMASK ioctl request. This can be exploited to trigger a kernel panic and potentially execute arbitrary code.

Code execution has not been confirmed by the vendor.

Loganaden Velvindron and Gleb Smirnoff reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (8.3.1P04).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB79597

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) FreeBSD SCTP Discloses Portions of Kernel Memory Contents to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
When the kernel initializes the SCTP state cookie for INIT-ACK chunks, a buffer allocated from the kernel stack is not properly initialized. As a result, fragments of kernel memory may be transmitted within SCTP packets over the network.

Julian Seward and Michael Tuexen reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (8.3.1P04).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB79597

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) FreeBSD Integer Overflow in IP_MSFILTER Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
A local user can trigger an integer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges.

Clement Lecigne (Google Security Team) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel privileges on the target system.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (8.3.1P04).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB79597

Title: WatchGuard XTM Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in WatchGuard XTM. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP cookie value to the remote administration interface on TCP port 8080 to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-6021]. The code will run with the privileges of the target WGagent service and can access the configuration file and change passwords.

Jerome Nokin and Thierry Zoller from Verizon Enterprise Solutions (GCIS Threat and Vulnerability Management) reported this vulnerability via US-CERT.

The WebCenter interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-5702]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the WatchGuard XTM WebCenter interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The following scripts are affected:

/log/device?sn=random&cluster_id=<XSS>&l_t=tr&name=random
/log/device?sn=random&cluster_id=random&l_t=tr&name=<XSS>
/log/log_html_distribution?sn=random&cluster_id=random&name=<XSS>

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]:4130/log/device?sn=random&cluster_id=&l_t=tr&name=<script>alert('rcesecurity.com')</script>

Julien Ahrens of RCE Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WatchGuard XTM WebCenter interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://watchguardsecuritycenter.com/2013/10/17/xtm-11-8-secfixes/

Title: Cisco Firewall Service Module Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Firewall Service Module. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local unprivileged user can invoke certain administrative commands to delete, modify, or view the configuration of any other context of the affected system [CVE-2013-5506].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue46080 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted segmented Transparent Network Substrate (TNS) packets through a target device to trigger a flaw in the SQL*Net inspection engine code and cause the device to reload [CVE-2013-5508]. 

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui34914 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

A local user can delete, modify, or view the configuration of other contexts on the system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2(27), 4.1(14)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131009-fwsm

Title: Cisco ASA Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Bypass Authentication and Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass authentication.
A remote user can send specially crafted ICMP packets through an active IPsec VPN tunnel to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5507]. Systems configured in routed mode in both single and multiple context mode are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue18975 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted segmented Transparent Network Substrate (TNS) packets through a target device to trigger a flaw in the SQL*Net inspection engine code and cause the device to reload [CVE-2013-5508].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub98434 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can use a specially crafted client digital certificate to bypass certificate authentication and access the target network via Clientless or Anyconnect SSL VPN or obtain administrative management access via Cisco Adaptive Security Device Management (ASDM) [CVE-2013-5509]. Systems configured for client digital certificate authentication for Clientless and AnyConnect SSL VPN or for remote management via Cisco ASDM are affected.

Cisco ASA 5510, Cisco ASA 5520, Cisco ASA 5540, and Cisco ASA 5550 are not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf52468 to this vulnerability.

A remote user with knowledge of a valid username can attempt to authenticate via remote VPN to the target device to trigger an LDAP parsing flaw to bypass VPN authentication and gain access to the target network [CVE-2013-5510]

Systems configured for Clientless or AnyConnect SSL VPN, IKEv1 and IKEv2 Remote IPsec VPN and L2TP/IPsec VPN are affected when an external AAA LDAP server is used for remote VPN authentication. On systems configured with IKEv1 Remote IPsec VPN and L2TP/IPsec VPN, the remote user must have knowledge of the tunnel-group password or have a valid digital certificate.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug83401 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the authentication code of remote management via Cisco Adaptive Security Device Management (ASDM) to bypass digital certificate authentication and gain administrator access on the management interface or take full control of the affected system [CVE-2013-5511].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh44815 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP response message through the target device to trigger a flaw in the HTTP Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) code and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5512].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud37992 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted DNS messages via TCP through the target device to trigger a flaw in the DNS Application Layer Protocol Inspection (ALPI) engine and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5513].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug03975 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted traffic to the IP address of a disconnected AnyConnect SSL VPN client to consume available memory and cause the target device to become unresponsive and drop transit traffic [CVE-2013-3415].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtt36737 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted HTTPS request to the TCP port used by the Clientless SSL VPN feature to cause the target system to reload [CVE-2013-5515].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCua22709 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted ICMP packets to or through the target device to cause arbitrary connections to be cleared the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui77398 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.2(5.12), 8.2(5.46), 8.3(2.39), 8.4(7), 8.5(1.18), 8.6(1.12), 8.7(1.7), 9.0(3.6), 9.1(2.8)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131009-asa

Title: Cisco ASA Idle Timeout Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The system does not properly manage the idle timeout for some protocol inspected connections. A remote user can cause the connection table to fill up, preventing new connections to be established through the device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh13899.
Impact': A remote user can prevent new connections through the device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3463

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
A remote user can send a query containing specially crafted rdata to cause the target service to crash.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

Both authoritative and recursive servers are affected.

BIND 9.6 and BIND 9.6-ESV are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (8.3.1P02).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB78975

Title: Cisco ASA OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Full Control of the Routing Table
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
A remote user can supply specially crafted unicast or multicast Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packets to take full control of the target OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table. The target router may flush the contents of its routing table and propagate the specially crafted LSA update throughout the OSPF area.

This can be exploited to redirect traffic to a blackhole or to redirect traffic and intercept communications.

OSPFv3 is not affected. Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug34469 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems and Eitan Menahem, Yuval Elovici, and Ariel Waizel of Telekom Innovation Laboratories at Ben Gurion University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table and redirect traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.4.6.5, 9.0.3, 9.1.2.5).

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130801-lsaospf

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Full Control of the Routing Table
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module. A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
A remote user can supply specially crafted unicast or multicast Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packets to take full control of the target OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table. The target router may flush the contents of its routing table and propagate the specially crafted LSA update throughout the OSPF area.

This can be exploited to redirect traffic to a blackhole or to redirect traffic and intercept communications.

OSPFv3 is not affected. Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug39762 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems and Eitan Menahem, Yuval Elovici, and Ariel Waizel of Telekom Innovation Laboratories at Ben Gurion University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table and redirect traffic.
Solution:
No official vendor releases are available at the time of this entry.

Interim releases may be available through Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130801-lsaospf

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Full Control of the Routing Table
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall. A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
A remote user can supply specially crafted unicast or multicast Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packets to take full control of the target OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table. The target router may flush the contents of its routing table and propagate the specially crafted LSA update throughout the OSPF area.

This can be exploited to redirect traffic to a blackhole or to redirect traffic and intercept communications.

OSPFv3 is not affected. Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug34469 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems and Eitan Menahem, Yuval Elovici, and Ariel Waizel of Telekom Innovation Laboratories at Ben Gurion University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table and redirect traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.4.6.5, 9.0.3, 9.1.2.5).

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130801-lsaospf

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in WebVPN Portal Login Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The WebVPN portal login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco ASA the WebVPN portal login page and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCug83080 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco ASA the WebVPN portal login page, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3414

Title: Cisco ASA Next-Generation Firewall Fragmented Traffic Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA Next-Generation Firewall. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented IPv4 or IPv6 packets through the target device to cause the device to reload.

The vendor has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCue88387 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1.1.9, 9.1.2.12).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130626-ngfw

Title: Cisco ASA CX TCP Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA CX. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The Cisco ASA CX does not properly parse TCP packet data forwarded by the Cisco ASA. A remote user can send specially crafted TCP data to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCue88386 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1203

Title: FortiGate Guest User Permission Flaw Lets Remote Users Access Other User Records
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FortiGate. A remote guest user can access other user records on the target system.
A remote guest user can view, modify, and delete records of users from another group.

Anderson Freitas reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote guest user can view, modify, and delete records of users from another group.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.fortiguard.com/advisory/FGA-2013-20/

Title: IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliance Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliances. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA appliance interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The XML Firewall, Multi Protocol Gateway, Web Service Proxy and Web Token Service services are affected.

A. Falkenberg of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA appliance interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21637717

Title: Cisco ASA 5505 Easy VPN Privilege Handling Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target device.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the handling of privileges for the vpnclient command to obtain elevated privileges.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuf85295 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco ASA 5505 is affected.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1215

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module IKE and Auth-Proxy Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IKEv1 message to the target system to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1149].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCud20267 to this vulnerability. 

A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to trigger a flaw in the auth-proxy feature and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1155].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtg02624 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM) Software for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2(24.1), 4.1(11.1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130410-fwsm

Title: Cisco ASA Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IKEv1 message to the target system to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1149].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCub85692 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to or through the target device to trigger a flaw in the authentication proxy feature and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1150].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCud16590 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted certificate to the target device to trigger an implementation error in the validation code and cause the target system to reload [CVE-2013-1151].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCuc72408 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted DNS message through the target device to trigger a DNS inspection error and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1152].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCuc80080 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.2(5.10), 8.0(5.31), 8.2(5.41), 8.3(2.37), 8.4(5.6), 8.6(1.10), 8.7(1.4), 9.0(2), 9.1(1.4)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130410-asa

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for ScreenOS) OpenSSL asn1_d2i_read_bio() Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Juniper ScreenOS is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target application using OpenSSL to potentially trigger a heap overflow in the asn1_d2i_read_bio() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.

Applications that use ASN.1 BIO or FILE based functions to read untrusted DER format data are affected. The d2i_*_bio and d2i_*_fp type of functions are affected.

Applications that use the memory based ASN1 functions (e.g., d2i_X509, d2i_PKCS12 etc) are not affected.

The SSL/TLS code is not affected.

Applications using only the PEM routines are not affected.

S/MIME and CMS applications that use the built-in MIME parser SMIME_read_PKCS7 and SMIME_read_CMS functions are affected.

Tavis Ormandy, Google Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for CVE-2012-2110 for ScreenOS.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://www.juniper.net/alerts/viewalert.jsp?actionBtn=Search&txtAlertNumber=PSN-2013-03-872&viewMode=view

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) BIND Regex Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request to cause the target named service to consume all available memory evaluating a regular expression and crash.

BIND 9.6.x and 10.x are not affected.

Windows-based versions are not affected.

Matthew Horsfall of Dyn, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target name service to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (8.2.1P08, 8.3.0E16, 8.3.1P01).

McAfee Firewall Enterprise version 8.x is affected. Version 7.x is not affected.

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB77902

Title: IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliance TLS/DTLS CBC Mode Oracle Padding Lets Remote Users Recover Plaintext
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliance. A remote user can recover plaintext in certain cases.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack against TLS or DTLS protected connections can recover the original plaintext when CBC-mode encryption is used.

A user with low latency access to the target server's network can send specially crafted encrypted data and monitor the response timing to determine the plaintext contents of the data. For certain message lengths where the HMAC-SHA1 MAC algorithm is used, TLS messages containing at least two bytes of correct padding will be processed slightly faster than TLS messages containing one byte of correct padding or padding that is incorrectly formatted. By analyzing the timing variations over a large number of connections, the original plaintext can be determined.

This attack is known as the 'Lucky Thirteen' attack.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS/DTLS protocol specification rather than in the specific SSL implementation. Many other implementations are affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.isg.rhul.ac.uk/tls/

Nadhem J. AlFardan and Kenneth G. Paterson of the Information Security Group Royal Holloway, University of London, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can recover plaintext in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issue a fix (APAR IC90431).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21626523

Title: Cisco ASA NAT Connections Table Memory Exhaustion Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets through the target system to consume memory allocated for the NAT connections table, which may prevent new connections from being established until the invalid entries expire.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCue46386 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can prevent new connections from being established.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/Cisco-SA-20130226-CVE-2013-1138

Title: Barracuda Web Application Firewall SSH Backdoor Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda Web Application Firewall. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The system includes several undocumented SSH user accounts that cannot be disabled and can be accessed from certain whitelisted IP ranges. At least one account can be exploited to gain shell access on the target device.

The SSH user account names are:

root
build
shutdown
product
ca
support
websupport
qa_test

The following IP ranges are whitelisted:

192.168.200.0/24
192.168.10.0/24
205.158.110.0/24
216.129.105.0/24

The vendor was notified on Nov 29, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sec-consult.com/fxdata/seccons/prod/temedia/advisories_txt/20130124-0_Barracuda_Appliances_Backdoor_wo_poc_v10.txt

S. Viehbock of SEC Consult reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Definition 2.0.5).

The fix retains several user accounts for support purposes. The vendor reportedly offers a special option (via customer support) that disables the SSH daemon.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.barracudanetworks.com/support/techalerts#40

Title: Cisco ASA SSH Timeout Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can establish multiple SSH sessions to cause the target service to crash.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtc59462 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-5717

Title: Cisco ASA CIFS UNC Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to become unavailable.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuc65775 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to become unavailable.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-6395

Title: Cisco ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall H.323 Inspection Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted H.323 message through the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Systems with H.323 inspection enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Bug IDs CSCuc42812 and CSCuc88741 to this vulnerability.

Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances, Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series ASA
Services Module, and the Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Firewall Services Module (FWSM) are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.7.1.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130116-asa1000v

Title: IBM WebSphere DataPower XC10 Appliance Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM WebSphere DataPower. A remote authenticated user can gain administrative privileges. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary JMX operations on the target system [CVE-2012-5759]. The vendor has assigned APAR IC85748 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to stop server processes [CVE-2012-5758]. The vendor has assigned APAR IC86908 to this vulnerability.

The product uses a common secret key for device-to-device communications. A remote user with knowledge of the key can impersonate appliance collective members [CVE-2012-5756]. The vendor has assigned APAR PM68926 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can gain administrative privileges.

A remote user can cause server processes to stop.

A remote user can impersonate appliance collective members.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21615783

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
A remote user can send a request for a record that has been loaded with specific combinations of RDATA to cause the target named service to lock up.

This can be exploited against recursive servers by causing the target recursive server to query for records provided by an authoritative server.

Jake Montgomery of Dyn, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to lock up and fail to respond to queries or control commands.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (7.0.1.03H06, 8.2.1P06, 8.3.0P02).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB76535

Title: Cisco ASA Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): ASA 5500 Series, Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series ASA Services Module
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted DHCP data via IPv4 to the DHCP server on the target device or through the target device to trigger a memory allocation error and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4643].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtw84068 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted response to an AAA challenge via IPv4 on an SSL VPN connection to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4659]. Cisco ASA Software configured for Clientless or AnyConnect SSL VPN is affected. IPsec VPN Server, IPSEC/L2TP VPN Server, or IKEv2 AnyConnect server configurations are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtz04566 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets (as part of an established SIP session) through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4660].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr63728 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted DCERPC data through the target device to trigger a stack overflow in the DCERPC inspection engine and execute arbitrary code on the target device or cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4661].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr21359 to this vulnerability. 

A remote user can send specially crafted DCERPC data through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4662, CVE-2012-4663].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtr21376 and CSCtr21346 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.2(5.8), 8.0(5.28), 8.1(2.56), 8.2(5.33), 8.3(2.34), 8.4(4.5), 8.5(1.14), 8.6(1.5)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20121010-asa

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted DCERPC data through the target device to trigger a stack overflow in the DCERPC inspection engine and execute arbitrary code on the target device or cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4661].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr27522 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted DCERPC data through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4662, CVE-2012-4663].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtr27524 and CSCtr27521 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.1(9)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20121010-fwsm

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Firewall Enterprise is affected.
A remote user can send a query for a record that has RDATA in excess of 65535 bytes to cause named to exit.

This can be exploited against recursive servers by causing the server to query for records provided by an authoritative server.

Authoritative servers are affected if a zone containing a specially crafted resource record is loaded from file or provided via zone transfer.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target named service to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (7.0.1.00E37, 7.0.1.02E188, 7.0.1.03H06, 8.1.2E33, 8.2.1P05, and 8.3.0P01).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB76379

Title: Cisco ASA-CX Context-Aware Security Appliance Logging Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco ASA-CX Context-Aware Security Appliance. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 packets to the management interface to cause the log file to grow and consume all available space in the '/var/log' partition. As a result, the device will stop processing user traffic and will not accept management access.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCub70603 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco Prime Security Manager (PRSM) is also affected.

The Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances, Cisco ASA Services Module (ASA-SM), and Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Firewall Services Module (FWSM) are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to become unavailable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.0.2-103).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120912-asacx

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (Sidewinder)) BIND DNSSEC Validation Cache Failure Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Firewall Enterprise (Sidewinder) is affected.
On systems configured for DNSSEC validation, a remote user can cause the cache of failing queries to be used before fully initialized, triggering an assertion failure.

Einar Lonn of IIS.se reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix (hotfix 821P03) for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (Sidewinder).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10032

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (Sidewinder)) ISC BIND Cache Update Policy Can Be Bypassed to Allow Revoked Domain Names to Remain Resolvable
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause revoked domain names to remain resolvable. McAfee Firewall Enterprise (Sidewinder) is affected.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the DNS cache update policy to cause a revoked domain name to remain as resolvable after the domain name has been deleted from the domain registry and after the associated TTL has expired.

The original advisory was presented at NDSS 2012 ("Ghost Domain Names: Revoked Yet Still Resolvable").

Jian Jiang, Jinjin Liang, Kang Li, Jun Li, Haixin Duan, and Jianping Wu reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause revoked domain names to remain resolvable.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix (hotfix 70103H04) for McAfee Firewall Enterprise (Sidewinder).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10032

Title: Cisco ASA SIP and WebVPN Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote or remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
On systems with SIP inspection enabled, a remote user can send specially crafted SIP traffic to cause the target device to create many identical pre-allocated secondary pinholes and cause excessive CPU consumption [CVE-2012-2472]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtz63143 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the clientless WebVPN feature to consume excessive memory on the target system [CVE-2012-2474]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCth34278 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause excessive memory consumption on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa84/release/notes/asarn84.html
http://www.cisco.com/web/software/280775065/45357/ASA-825-Interim-Release-Notes.html

Title: Cisco ASA 5500 Series IPv6 Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 data through the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCua27134 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series ASA Services Module (Cisco ASASM) is also affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.4(4.1), 8.5(1.11), 8.6 (1.3)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120620-asaipv6

Title: Cisco ASA Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct HTTP Response Splitting and Denial of Service Attacks and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct HTTP response splitting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can exploit a CRLF injection flaw in '/+CSCOE+/logon.html' to cause the target server to return a split response [CVE-2011-3285]. A remote user can exploit this to spoof content on the target server, attempt to poison any intermediate web caches, or conduct cross-site scripting attacks. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCth63101 to this vulnerability. ASA 5500 series devices with software 8.0 through 8.4 are affected.

A remote user can read IKE responder traffic to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2011-3309]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtt07749 to this vulnerability. ASA 5500 series devices with software 8.2 through 8.4 are affected.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in cut-through proxy authentication processing to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0335]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtx42746 to this vulnerability. Cisco Adaptive Security Appliances (ASA) 5500 series devices with software 7.2 through 8.4 are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the ESMTP inspection feature and cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system [CVE-2011-4006]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtt32565 to this vulnerability. ASA 5500 series devices with software 8.2 through 8.5 are affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target device.

A remote user can cause arbitrary content to be displayed.

A remote user may be able to poison any intermediate web caches with arbitrary content.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/web/software/280775065/37740/ASA-805-Interim-Release-Notes.html
http://www.cisco.com/web/software/280775065/45357/ASA-825-Interim-Release-Notes.html
http://www.cisco.com/web/software/280775065/89203/ASA-843-Interim-Release-Notes.html
http://www.cisco.com/web/software/283878312/88166/ASA-851-Interim-Release-Notes.html

Title: Cisco ASA Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data via UDP through the device to trigger a flaw in the UDP inspection engine and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-0353]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq10441 to this vulnerability.

The following UDP-based protocols may be affected:

  * Domain Name System (DNS)
  * Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)
  * Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)
  * GPRS Tunneling Protocol (GTP)
  * H.323, H.225 RAS
  * Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP)
  * SunRPC
  * Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP)
  * X Display Manager Control Protocol (XDMCP)
  * IBM NetBios
  * Instant Messaging (depending on the particular IM client/solution being used)

When the target device is configured with the Cisco ASA Scanning Threat Mode feature and with the shun option enabled, a remote user can cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-0354]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtw35765 to this vulnerability.

If a remote user can create a condition that will cause syslog message ID 305006 to be generated, the remote user can cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-0355]. Syslog message ID 305006 is generated when the device is unable to create a network address translation for a new connection. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts39634 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) message to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-0356]. Devices with multicast routing enabled are affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr47517 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series ASA Services Module (ASASM) is also affected by these vulnerabilities.

The vendor reports that Cisco PIX Security Appliances may be affected by some of the vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120314-asa

Title: Cisco ASA Clientless VPN ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Clientless VPN ActiveX control (cscopf.ocx) and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

The CLSID of the vulnerable control is:

B8E73359-3422-4384-8D27-4EA1B4C01232

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr00165 to this vulnerability.

Will Dormann of the CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.2(5.7), 8.2(5.26), 8.4(3.8), 8.5(1.7), 8.6(1.1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120314-asaclient

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) message to cause the target device to reload. Devices with multicast routing enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtu97367 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2(23), 4.1(8)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120314-fwsm

Title: Barracuda Web Application Firewall Input Validation Hole in 'filter' Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda Web Application Firewall. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The 'sessions_by_user' function does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'filter' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Barracuda Web Application Firewall interface and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor was notified on February 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=444

Benjamin Kunz Mejri (Rem0ve) from Vulnerability Research Laboratory reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Barracuda Web Application Firewall interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: IBM WebSphere DataPower Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL/TLS Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere DataPower. A remote user can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions in certain cases.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions.

Thai Duong and Juliano Rizzo reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions.
Solution:
The vendor has described configuration methods to correct the vulnerability.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21578730

Title: FortiGate UTM WAF Appliance Permits Scripting Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FortiGate UTM WAF Appliance. A remote user can conduct scripting injection attacks.
The administration interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user or remote authenticated can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the FortiGate device and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'Endpoint => Monitor => Endpoint Monitor', 'Dailup List', and Log&Report => Display' menu items are affected.

The 'Endpoint -> NAC -> Application Database -> Listings' and 'List field sorted' menu items are affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=144

Benjamin Kunz Mejri (Rem0ve) from Vulnerability Research Laboratory reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the FortiGate device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Firewall Service Module Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass TACACS+ Authentication in Certain Cases and Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Service Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass TACACS+ authentication in certain cases.
The Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series switches and Cisco 7600 Series routers are affected.

A specific system log message (message ID 302015, "Built outbound UDP connection session-id for src-intf:IP/Port to dst-intf:IP/Port ARP-Incomplete") can trigger a memory corruption error and cause the target system to lock up or crash [CVE-2011-3296]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti83875 to this vulnerability.

Systems with interfaces with IPv6 addresses are affected.

A manual reboot may be required to return the system to normal operations. 

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the cut-through proxy to cause denial of service conditions on devices configured to use cut-through proxy authentication [CVE-2011-3297]. A high number of network access authentication requests can trigger the flaw. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtn15697 to this vulnerability.

A remote user with access to the network between the TACACS+ server and the ASA device can bypass TACACS+ authentication of VPN users, firewall sessions, or administrative access to the device [CVE-2011-3298]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto74274 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SunRPC data over UDP through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3299, CVE-2011-3300, CVE-2011-3301, and CVE-2011-3302]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtq09972
CSCtq09978, CSCtq09986, and CSCtq09989 to these vulnerabilities. 

A remote user can send specially crafted data through the target device to trigger a flaw in the ILS inspection engine and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3303]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq57802 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to hang or reload.

A remote user can bypass TACACS+ authentication in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.1(21), 3.2(22), 4.0(16), 4.1(7)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20111005-fwsm.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA 5500 Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass TACACS+ Authentication in Certain Cases and Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA 5500. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can bypass TACACS+ authentication in certain cases.
The Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series ASA Services Module is also affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted MSN IM data through the target device to trigger a flaw in the IM inspection feature and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3304]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtl67486 to this vulnerability.
