A remote user with access to the network between the TACACS+ server and the ASA device can bypass TACACS+ authentication of VPN users, firewall sessions, or administrative access to the device [CVE-2011-3298]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto40365 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SunRPC data over UDP through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3299, CVE-2011-3300, CVE-2011-3301, and CVE-2011-3302]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCto92380,
CSCtq06065, CSCtq06062, and CSCto92398 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can send specially crafted data through the target device to trigger a flaw in the ILS inspection engine and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3303]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq57697 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

A remote user can bypass TACACS+ authentication in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8.13), 7.2(5.4), 8.0(5.25), 8.2(5.11), 8.3(2.24), 8.4(2.7), 8.5(1.1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20111005-asa.shtml

Title: Barracuda IM Firewall Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda IM Firewall. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Barracuda IM Firewall interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'SMTP TEST - Email' and 'Logs/Reports - User Reports' components are affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=27

Benjamin Kunz Mejri (Rem0ve) and Pim J.F. Campers (X4lt) of Vulnerability Research Laboratory reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Barracuda IM Firewall interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor has reportedly issued a fix.

Title: Barracuda NG Firewall SSH Login Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands With Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): prior to 5.02; also phion netfence 4.0.x and 4.2 prior to 4.2.15
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda NG Firewall. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote user with knowledge of the administrator's username can exploit a flaw in the SSH login procedure to execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.  The commands will run with root privileges.

Systems using an external authentication method such as Active Directory are affected.

The vendor was notified on March 14, 2011.

Wolfgang Neudorfer and Lukas Nothdurfter reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target device with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a hotfix (on March 15, 2011):

Hotfix 392_Authentication for netfence 4.0.x
Hotfix 390_Authentication for netfence 4.2.x
Hotfix 391_Authentication for NG Firewall 5.0.x

Title: ZyWALL USG Appliances Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Read/Write Configuration Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ZyWALL USG Appliances. A remote user can read and write configuration files on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to bypass access controls on the web management interface. This can be exploited to upload and apply configuration files and take full control of the target device.

The following appliances are affected:

ZyWALL USG-20
ZyWALL USG-20W
ZyWALL USG-50
ZyWALL USG-100
ZyWALL USG-200
ZyWALL USG-300
ZyWALL USG-1000
ZyWALL USG-1050
ZyWALL USG-2000

Other products may be affected.

The vendor was notified on April 7, 2011.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.redteam-pentesting.de/advisories/rt-sa-2011-003

RedTeam Pentesting GmbH reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can read and write configuration files on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (Firmware Releases from or after April 25, 2011).

Title: Trustwave WebDefend Enterprise Default Credentials Let Remote Users Access the Device
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Trustwave WebDefend Enterprise. A remote user can access the target device.
The appliance uses a static console username and password. A remote user with knowledge of the password, and with the private key, can access the device and gain read-only access to security event data. Systems prior to version 5.0 are affected.

The appliance uses a static username and password for the MySQL database. A remote user with knowledge of the password can access the event collection table, including IP and URL data.
Impact': A remote user can access the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0 version 7.01.903-1.4; in January 2011).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.trustwave.com/spiderlabs/advisories/TWSL2011-001.txt

Title: Trustwave WebDefend Enterprise Manager Appliance Lets Remote Authenticated 'bgoperator' Users Gain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Trustwave WebDefend Enterprise Manager Appliance. A remote authenticated user can gain root privileges on the target device.
A remote authenticated 'bgoperator' user can access the target device via ssh, view a log file, and press 'v' to cause the 'more' command to load the vi editor with root privileges. This can be exploited to read or write arbitrary files with root privileges. Modifying the account's login script allows the remote authenticated user to gain a root shell on the target device.

The vendor was notified on January 26, 2011.

A demonstration exploit video is available at:

http://www.securitypentest.com/2011/04/webdefend-privilege-escalation-poc.html

Nathan Power of www.securitypentest.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated 'bgoperator' user can gain root privileges on the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module SCCP Inspection Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Skinny Client Control Protocol (SCCP) data through the target device to cause the device to reload. Systems with SCCP inspection enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtl84952 to this vulnerability.

The FWSM for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.1(20), 3.2(20), 4.0(15), 4.1(5)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110223-fwsm.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA 5500 Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Access Files on the Target Device
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA 5500. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can access files on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 data to a device that is not configured for IPv6 to exhaust the packet buffers and cause the target device to stop forwarding traffic [CVE-2011-0393]. Systems configured for transparent firewall mode are affected. IPv6 data traversing the device does not affect the device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtj04707 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SCCP message through the device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-0394]. Systems with SCCP inspection enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtg69457 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send valid RIP updates to cause the device to reload [CVE-2011-0395]. Systems with both RIP and the Cisco Phone Proxy feature enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtg66583 to this vulnerability.

When the device is configured as a local CA server, a remote user can access a file system (e.g., flash:, disk0:, disk1:), which may contain sensitive information such as passwords, shared secrets, software images, and digital certificates [CVE-2011-0396]. The 'system:' file system cannot be accessed.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtk12352 to this vulnerability.

Cisco PIX 500 Series Security Appliances are affected by the buffer exhaustion and SCCP inspection vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload or stop processing traffic.

A remote user can access potentially sensitive files on the filesystem.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8.12), 7.2(5.2), 8.0(5.23), 8.1(2.49), 8.2(4.1), 8.3(2.13)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110223-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service and Bypass Security Controls
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass security controls.
A remote user can send specially crafted LAN-to-LAN (aka L2L) IPsec sessions to cause unspecified denial of service conditions [CVE-2010-4692]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCth36592 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially rafted multicast traffic to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-4691]. Cisco has assignd Bug IDs CSCtg61810 and CSCtg69742 to this vulnerability.

A remote user may be able to send a specially crafted HEAD request to the Mobile User Security (MUS) service to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2010-4690]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCte53635 to this vulnerability.

The device does not properly preserve ACL behavior after a migration [CVE-2010-4688]. A remote user can send unspecified data to bypass access restrictions. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCte46460 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP calls to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-4689]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCte20030 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted LDAP authentication requests to trigger a memory leak and consume excessive memory on the target device [CVE-2010-4682]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtf29867 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to bypass SMTP inspection [CVE-2010-4681]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCte14901 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can view CIFS shares via WebVPN when CIFS file browing has been disabled [CVE-2010-4680]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsz80777 to this vulnerability.

The device does not properly handle Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) connection failures [CVE-2010-4679]. A remote user can exhaust all available TCP sockets. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsz36816 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send data while the device is starting up to bypass access restrictions [CVE-2010-4678]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsy86769 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted request via emWeb for a document with a name that contains space characters to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-4677]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsy08416 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send a high volume of IPSec traffic to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-4676]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsx52748 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated users can bypass Telnet access restrictions [CVE-2010-4675]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsv40504 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted multicast traffic to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2010-4674]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtg63992 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a packet flood to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2010-4673]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtg06316 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted EIGRP traffic to trigger an EIGRP multicast storm [CVE-2010-4672]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtf20269 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send Router Advertisement (RA) messages via IPv6 with different source addresses to cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system or possibly cause the target device to hang [CVE-2010-4670]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCti24526 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can cause an ADSM syslog outage by sending a long URL [CVE-2009-5037]. Cisco has assigned Bug IDs CSCsm11264 and CSCtb92911 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can bypass certain security controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.3(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa83/release/notes/asarn83.pdf

Title: Cisco ASA IKE Responses Let Remote Users Determine Valid Groupnames
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can determine valid group names on the target device.
A remote user can discover which group names are configured and valid on the target device.

Systems using a pre-shared key for group authentication in a remote access VPN scenario are affected.  Site-to-site VPNs are not affected.  

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtj96108 to this vulnerability.

Cisco PIX 500 Series Security Appliances and the Cisco VPN 3000 Series Concentrators are also affected.

VPN 3000 Series systems using 'Mutual Group Authentication' are not affected.

Gavin Jones of NGS Secure reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid group names on the target device.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20101124-vpn-grpname.shtml

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module SunRPC and TCP Protocol Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SunRPC data through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2818, CVE-2010-2819, and CVE-2010-2820].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCte61710, CSCte61622, and CSCte61662 to these vulnerabilities.

Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers using the Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM) are affected.  Systems with SunRPC inspection enabled (the default setting) are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data via TCP to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2821].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtg68694 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers using the Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM) configured in multi-mode (with virtual firewalls) and configured to accept Telnet, SSH, or ASDM connections are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.1(17.2), 3.2(17.2), 4.0(11.1), 4.1(1.2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100804-fwsm.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA SunRPC/TLS/SIP/IKE Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SunRPC data via UDP through the target device to trigger a flaw in the SunRPC inspection feature and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-1578, CVE-2010-1579, and CVE-2010-1580].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtc77567, CSCtc79922, and CSCtc85753 to these vulnerabilities.

Versions 7.2.x, 8.0.x, 8.1.x, and 8.2.x are affected.

Cisco PIX 500 Series devices are also affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted Transport Layer Security (TLS) packets to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-1581, CVE-2010-2814, and CVE-2010-2815].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtd32627, CSCtf37506, and CSCtf55259 to these vulnerabilities.

Versions 7.2.x, 8.0.x, 8.1.x, 8.2.x, and 8.3.x are affected.

Devices configured for SSL VPN, TLS Proxy for Encrypted Voice Inspection, or configured to accept ASDM management connections are vulnerable.

Cisco PIX 500 Series devices are also affected.

CERT-FI reported one of these TLS vulnerabilities.

A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2816].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtd32106 to this vulnerability.

Versions 8.0.x, 8.1.x, and 8.2.x are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted Internet Key Exchange (IKE) messages to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2817].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCte46507 to this vulnerability.

Versions 7.0.x, 7.1.x, 7.2.x, 8.0.x, 8.1.x, and 8.2.x are affected.

Cisco PIX 500 Series devices are also affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8.11), 7.2(5), 8.0(5.19), 8.1(2.47), 8.2(2.17), 8.3(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100804-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA URL Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct HTTP Response Splitting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.
The HTTP web interface of the ASA does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to cause the target server to return a split response.  A remote user can exploit this to spoof content on the target ASA appliance, attempt to poison any intermediate web caches, or conduct cross-site scripting attacks.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/%0d%0aLocation%3a%20http%3a%2f%2fwww%2egoogle%2ecom

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsr09163 to this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.secureworks.com/ctu/advisories/SWRX-2010-001

Daniel King of SecureWorks reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary content to be displayed.

A remote user may be able to poison any intermediate web caches with arbitrary content.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.1(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa81/release/notes/asarn812.html

Title: McAfee UTM Firewall Input Validation Flaw in Help Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee UTM Firewall.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The management console help feature does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by an authenticated target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the McAfee UTM Firewall device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The remote user must know the internal IP address for the target UTM device.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:


The vendor was notified on January 21, 2010.

The original advisory is available at:

http://ngenuity-is.com/advisories/2010/jun/9/mcafee-utm-firewall-help-cross-site-scripting/

Adam Baldwin of Ngenuity Information Services reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the McAfee UTM Firewall device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.0.7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10010

Title: Cisco ASA TCP, SIP, SCCP, DTLS, and IKE Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP data to consume all available TCP connections and prevent any new TCP connections [CVE-2010-0149].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsz77717 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP messages to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-0150, CVE-2010-0569].  Systems with SIP inspection enabled are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCsy91157 and CSCtc96018 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SCCP messages to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-0151].  Systems with SCCP inspection enabled are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsz79757 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted DTLS message to the DTLS port to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-0565].  Systems configured for WebVPN and DTLS transport are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtb64913 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted TCP segment in certain situations to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-0566].  When the TCP segment matches a static NAT translation that has the "nailed" option configured and when the TCP segment is also processed by the Cisco AIP-SSM, configured for inline mode of operation the system is affected.  A TCP three-way handshake is not necessary to exploit this vulnerability.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtb37219 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted IKE message via an existing IPsec tunnel to cause all IPsec tunnels terminating on the target appliance to be torn down and prevent new tunnels from being established [CVE-2010-0567].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtc47782 to this vulnerability.

Cisco PIX 500 Series devices are also affected by the TCP, SIP, SCCP, and IKE vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can exhaust all available TCP connections, requiring a restart to return to normal operations.

A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8.10), 7.2(4.46), 8.0(5.7), 8.1(2.37), 8.2(1.16)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100217-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module SCCP Protocol Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Skinny Client Control Protocol (SCCP) messages to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM) for the Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers are affected when SCCP inspection is enabled.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtb60485 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.0(8)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100217-fwsm.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA NTLMv1 Authentication Error Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can bypass authentication.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted username during an authentication request to bypass authentication and gain access to the target device.  Devices configured to authenticate users against Microsoft Windows servers using the NTLMv1 protocol are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCte21953 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication and gain access to the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8.10), 7.2(4.45), 8.0(5.7), 8.1(2.40), 8.2(2.1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100217-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA WebVPN Bookmark List Can Be Bypassed By Remote Authenticated Users
Description:
David Eduardo Acosta Rodriguez of ISecAuditors reported vulnerability in Cisco ASA.  A remote authenticated user can bypass the WebVPN bookmark list to access ostensibly protected resources on the internal network.
A remote authenticated Clientless SSL VPN user can send a specially crafted URL to access internal network resources that are not listed on the WebVPN home page.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtd73211 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on December 9, 2009.

[Editor's note:  The vendor does not consider the WebVPN bookmark feature to be an access control feature.]
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access ostensibly protected resources on the internal network.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=19609

Title: Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Feature Lets Remote Users Bypass Web Browser Same-Origin Policy Restrictions
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can bypass the same-origin policy restrictions provided by the web browser.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user via a clientless SSL VPN, will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the VPN or with arbitrary sites accessed via the VPN, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the sites, or take actions on the sites acting as the target user.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/261869

David Warren and Ryan Giobbi from US-CERT reported this vulnerability, based on initial research from Michael Zalewski.

[Editor's notes:  Products from several vendors are affected, including Cisco, Juniper, SafeNet, and SonicWall.]
Impact': A remote user can bypass the same-origin policy restrictions provided by the web browser to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the VPN or with arbitrary sites accessed via the VPN, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the sites, or take actions on the sites acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module for the Catalyst 6500 Series and Cisco 7600 Series devices.  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtd04061 to this vulnerability.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  The flaw resides in the protocol and not in the protocol implementation.  Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified.  Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091109-tls.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA).  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID to CSCtd00697 this vulnerability.

The Cisco ASA Advanced Inspection and Prevention (AIP) Security Services Module is also affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtd01539 to this vulnerability.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  The flaw resides in the protocol and not in the protocol implementation.  Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified.  Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091109-tls.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for PIX) Various TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in various TCP stack implementations.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Multiple vendors and products are affected.  Cisco PIX is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target TCP connection queue.

Published reports indicate that a TCP connection must be established with the target system to exploit these vulnerabilities and that the vulnerabilities are based on weaknesses in the TCP protocol.

Robert E. Lee and Jack Louis of Outpost24 reported these vulnerabilities.

The vulnerabilities were publicly referenced in August 2008 in a blog posting:

http://blog.robertlee.name/2008/08/updates.html

CERT-FI is coordinating with affected vendors.

The CERT-FI advisory is available at:

https://www.cert.fi/haavoittuvuudet/2008/tcp-vulnerabilities.html

[Editor's note:  This Alert is a placeholder to document the overall vendor community investigation of these vulnerabilities.  As vendors and researchers confirm which specific products are affected, separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix (7.0(8.6), 7.1(2.81), 7.2(4.30), 8.0(4.28), 8.1(2.19)) for PIX, which is affected by this vulnerability.

Versions 7.0, 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, and 8.1 are affected when configured for any of the following features:

  * SSL VPNs
  * ASDM Administrative Access
  * Telnet Access
  * SSH Access
  * Cisco Tunneling Control Protocol (cTCP) for Remote Access VPNs
  * Virtual Telnet
  * Virtual HTTP
  * Transport Layer Security (TLS) Proxy for Encrypted Voice Inspection
  * Cut-Through Proxy for Network Access

Version 8.2 is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv02768 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090908-tcp24.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for ASA) Various TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in various TCP stack implementations.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Multiple vendors and products are affected.  Cisco ASA is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target TCP connection queue.

Published reports indicate that a TCP connection must be established with the target system to exploit these vulnerabilities and that the vulnerabilities are based on weaknesses in the TCP protocol.

Robert E. Lee and Jack Louis of Outpost24 reported these vulnerabilities.

The vulnerabilities were publicly referenced in August 2008 in a blog posting:

http://blog.robertlee.name/2008/08/updates.html

CERT-FI is coordinating with affected vendors.

The CERT-FI advisory is available at:

https://www.cert.fi/haavoittuvuudet/2008/tcp-vulnerabilities.html

[Editor's note:  This Alert is a placeholder to document the overall vendor community investigation of these vulnerabilities.  As vendors and researchers confirm which specific products are affected, separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix (7.0(8.6), 7.1(2.81), 7.2(4.30), 8.0(4.28), 8.1(2.19)) for ASA, which is affected by this vulnerability.

Versions 7.0, 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, and 8.1 are affected when configured for any of the following features:

  * SSL VPNs
  * ASDM Administrative Access
  * Telnet Access
  * SSH Access
  * Cisco Tunneling Control Protocol (cTCP) for Remote Access VPNs
  * Virtual Telnet
  * Virtual HTTP
  * Transport Layer Security (TLS) Proxy for Encrypted Voice Inspection
  * Cut-Through Proxy for Network Access

Version 8.2 is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv02768 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090908-tcp24.shtml

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module ICMP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted ICMP messages to cause one of the Network Processors (NPs) used by the Firewall Services Module (FWSM) to consume all available execution threads.  As a result, the FWSM will stop processing transit traffic and stop processing traffic on the FWSM management interface. 

The system is affected regardless of whether ICMP inspection is enabled.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsz97207 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS Software, Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances, and Cisco
PIX Security Appliances are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to stop processing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.1(16), 3.2(13), 4.0(6)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090819-fwsm.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and HTML Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco ASA WebVPN device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user may be able to obtain the target user's authentication credentials in certain cases.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.4.34, 8.1.2.25).

Title: Juniper NetScreen ScreenOS Discloses Firmware Version Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper NetScreen ScreenOS.  A remote user can determine the active ScreenOS version number.
A remote user can request the 'about.html' file from the web interface to determine the version number and patch level of the firmware running on the target device.

The vendor was notified on March 22, 2009.

Richard Brain of ProCheckUp Ltd (www.procheckup.com) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine the firmware version number.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.2.0r2.0, 6.2R2, and 5.4.0r12).

No vendor advisory was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in Clientless SSL VPN Feature Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The clientless SSL VPN 'index.html' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the HTTP Host header before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted HTTP POST request that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the Cisco ASA SSL VPN page and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor was notified on February 15, 2008.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsy82093 to this vulnerability.

BugsNotHugs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco ASA VPN site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to include a fix in versions 8.0.3.31, 8.1.2.22, and 8.2.0.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=17950

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for PIX Firewall) Cisco ASA Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Control List Implicit Deny Feature
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user may be able to bypass access controls and traverse the firewall.  Cisco PIX is affected.
A remote user may be able to bypass the implicit deny behavior at the end of Access Control Lists (ACLs) on the target device.

ACLs with explicit deny statements are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq91277 to this vulnerability.

Jon Ramsey, Jeff Jarmoc, and Fernando Medrano from SecureWorks reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to bypass access controls and traverse the firewall.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8)6, 7.1(2)82, 7.2(4)30, 8.0(4)28).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090408-asa.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for PIX Firewall) Cisco ASA account-override-ignore Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass VPN Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can bypass authentication.  Cisco PIX is affected.
A remote user can access a VPN session without authenticating.

Devices configured for IPsec or SSL-based remote access VPN that have the Override Account Disabled feature enabled are affected (not the default configuration).

Versions 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, and 8.1 are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsx47543 to this vulnerability.

Cisco PIX is affected.
Impact': A remote user can bypass VPN authentication.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8)6, 7.1(2)82, 7.2(4)30, 8.0(4)28, 8.1(2)19).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090408-asa.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for PIX Firewall) Cisco ASA HTTP, TCP, H.323, and SQL*Net Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Cisco PIX is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP, TCP, H.323, or SQL*Net to cause the target device to reload.

HTTP packet processing is affected when the device is configured for SSL VPNs or to accept Cisco Adaptive Security Device Manager (ASDM) connections [CVE-2009-1156].  Versions 8.0 and 8.1 are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv52239 to this vulnerability.

TCP packet processing is affected by a memory leak when any of the following services is configured [CVE-2009-1157]:

  * SSL VPNs
  * ASDM Administrative Access
  * Telnet Access
  * SSH Access
  * Cisco Tunneling Control Protocol (cTCP) for Remote Access VPNs
  * Virtual Telnet
  * Virtual HTTP
  * Transport Layer Security (TLS) Proxy for Encrypted Voice Inspection
  * Cut-Through Proxy for Network Access
  * TCP Intercept

Versions 7.0, 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, and 8.1 are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy22484 to this vulnerability.  A completed three-way handshake is not required to exploit this flaw.  Exploit code is publicly available for this vulnerability.  Gregory W. MacPherson and Robert J. Combo from Verizon Business reported this vulnerability.

H.323 packet processing is affected when H.323 inspection is enabled (the default configuration) [CVE-2009-1158].  Versions 7.0, 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, and 8.1 are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsx32675 to this vulnerability.  A completed three-way handshake is not required to exploit this flaw.

SQL*Net packet processing is affected when SQL*Net inspection is enabled (the default configuration [CVE-2009-1159].  Versions 7.2, 8.0, and 8.1 are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsw51809 to this vulnerability.

Cisco PIX is also affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0(8)6, 7.1(2)82, 7.2(4)30, 8.0(4)28, 8.1(2)19).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090408-asa.shtml

Title: IBM WebSphere DataPower Security Gateway Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere DataPower XS40.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data over an SSL connection to cause the target device to crash and reboot.

erik at psafe.nl reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution: The report indicates that a fix is included in 3.6.1.12.

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall Windows NT Domain Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass IPSec/SSL VPN Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote user may be able to bypass VPN authentication.
When the target device is configured for IPSec or SSL-based remote access VPNs using Microsoft Windows NT Domain authentication, a remote user may be able to bypass authentication and access the VPN.

Other types of external authentication (i.e., LDAP, RADIUS, TACACS+, SDI, or local database) are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsu65735 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass VPN authentication.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (7.0(8)3, 7.1(2)78, 7.2(4)16, 8.0(4)6, 8.1(1)13).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20081022-asa.shtml

A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user may be able to bypass VPN authentication.

Title: Cisco ASA Bug in Hardware Crypto Accelerator Support Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted packets destined to the target device to trigger a memory leak in the hardware crypto accelerator initialization code.  The target device may reload.

The processing of packets traversing the device is not affected.

The following features may be affected because they use the hardware crypto accelerator:

    * Clientless WebVPN, SSL VPN Client, and AnyConnect Connections
    * ASDM (HTTPS) Management Sessions
    * Cut-Through Proxy for Network Access
    * TLS Proxy for Encrypted Voice Inspection
    * IP Security (IPsec) Remote Access and Site-to-site VPNs
    * Secure Shell (SSH) Access

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj25896 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (8.0(4), 8.1(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20081022-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall IPv6 Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet destined to the target device to cause the target device to reload.

The processing of packets traversing the device are not affected.

Devices configured for IPv6 may be affected.

Devices configured only for IPv4 are not affected.

Versions in the 7.0, 7.1, 8.0, and 8.1 releases are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsu11575 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (7.2(4)11).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20081022-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA Clientless VPN Feature May Disclose Sensitive Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user that can cause the target user to connect to a remote server or reply to an e-mail can obtain potentially sensitive information, such as usernames and passwords.

Systems with clientless VPNs enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq45636 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, such as VPN usernames and passwords.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (8.0(3)16, 8.1(1)6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080903-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA SSL VPN Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA in the processing of SSL VPNs.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SSL or HTTP packet to trigger a memory leak or URI processing flaw and cause the target device to reload.

Devices configured to terminate SSL VPNs are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCso66472 and CSCsq19369 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (7.2(4)2, 8.0(3)14, and 8.1(1)4).

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080903-asa.shtml

Description:

A remote user can send specially crafted ISAKMP authentication data to cause the target device to reload.

Devices that terminate remote access VPN connections are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso69942 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

Title: Cisco Firewall Service Module Predictable Source Port Address Translation Leaves DNS Servers Vulnerable to Recent Cache Poisoning Attack
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Service Module.  A remote user can conduct DNS cache poisoning attacks through the firewall in certain cases when port address translation is enabled.
The device uses a predictable source port allocation method when performing port address translation.  As a result, a DNS server that is ostensibly protected by the firewall may still be vulnerable to the DNS cache poisoning flaw described in CVE-2008-1447 even if patched against that flaw.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsr29124 to this vulnerability.

Network address translation configurations that provide a separate public IP address for each private IP address are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can conduct DNS cache poisoning attacks that may bypass the target DNS vendor's fix.
Solution:
No public information was available at the time of this entry.

[Editor's note:  Cisco has not issued a security advisory for this vulnerability.]

Title: Secure Computing Sidewinder DNS Query Port Entropy Weakness Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sidewinder.  A remote user can spoof the system.
The domain name system (DNS) service does not use sufficiently random UDP sockets to process queries.  A remote user can send specially crafted DNS queries and responses to the target service to spoof responses and insert records into the DNS cache.  This may cause traffic to be redirected to arbitrary IP addresses specified by the remote user.

Secure Computing CyberGuard is also affected.

Dan Kaminsky of IOActive reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can spoof the DNS service, causing traffic to be redirected to arbitrary hosts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for Sidewinder and Sidewinder G2.  Additional information is available in Knowledge Base article number 11446.

No vendor advisory was publicly available at the time of this entry.

Title: Juniper ScreenOS DNS Query Port Entropy Weakness Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper NetScreen ScreenOS.  A remote user can spoof the system.
The domain name system (DNS) service does not use sufficiently random UDP sockets to process queries. A remote user can send specially crafted DNS queries and responses to the target service to spoof responses and insert records into the DNS cache. This may cause traffic to be redirected to arbitrary IP addresses specified by the remote user.

Dan Kaminsky of IOActive reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can spoof the DNS service, causing traffic to be redirected to arbitrary hosts.
Solution:
It is unclear if a fix is available or not.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.juniper.net/alerts/viewalert.jsp?actionBtn=Search&txtAlertNumber=PSN-2008-06-040&viewMode=view

Title: (Ingate Firewall is Affected) Net-snmp SNMPv3 Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp.  A remote user can bypass authentication.  Ingate Firewall is affected.
A remote user can send an SNMPv3 packet with a specially crafted Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) value to bypass the authentication function.  The user can read and modify SNMP objects with the privileges of the target user.

UCD-SNMP is also affected.

SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 are not affected.

Wes Hardaker reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution:
Ingate Firewall is affected by this vulnerability.  Ingate plans to issue a fix as part of the next regular release, due in Q3 2008.

Ingate has provided the following workaround [quoted]:

The problem can be mitigated by using the "Servers allowed to contact
the firewall via SNMP" setting, so that it is restricted to the IP
address(es) of your management station(s).  This setting can restrict
access to a set of IP addresses and/or via a certain physical
interface.

The SNMP agent listens to a configurable interface on the Ingate
Firewall and SIParator.  If a non-routeable IP address is used
attackers from the Internet cannot reach the SNMP agent.

It is also possible to turn off the SNMP agent, if you consider the
potential information leak to be more serious than the loss of
monitoring.

Title: Cisco ASA May Let Remote Users Bypass Control-plane ACLs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user may be able to bypass control-plane access control lists.
A control-plane access control list (ACL) may not work after it is initially configured on the device.  As a result, a remote user may be able to connect to the target device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsm67466 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to connect to the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0(3)9).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080604-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA Bug in IM Inspection Engine Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Instant Messenger (IM) packets through the device to trigger a flaw in the IM inspection engine and to cause the target device to become unavailable.

Systems with the IM inspection engine enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso22981 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to become unavailable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.2(4), 8.0(3)10, 8.1(1)2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080604-asa.shtml

Description:

A remote user can send specially crafted Instant Messenger (IM) packets through the device to trigger a flaw in the IM inspection engine and to cause the target device to become unavailable.

Systems with the IM inspection engine enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso22981 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to become unavailable.

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080604-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA TLS Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TLS packets to the device to cause the target device to reload.

Packets traversing the device cannot trigger this vulnerability.

Versions prior to 8.0(3)9 on the 8.0.x release or prior to version 8.1(1)1 on the 8.1.x release are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsm26841 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0(3)9, 8.1(1)1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080604-asa.shtml

A remote user can send a specially crafted TLS packets to the device to cause the target device to reload.

Packets traversing the device cannot trigger this vulnerability.

Title: Cisco ASA TCP ACK Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TCP ACK packet to the device to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.

Packets traversing the device cannot trigger this vulnerability.

Versions 7.1.x and 7.2.x with WebVPN, SSL VPN, or ASDM enabled are affected. Version 8.0 with Telnet, Secure Shell (SSH), WebVPN, SSL VPN, or ASDM enabled is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsm84110 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1(2)70, 7.2(4), 8.0(3)10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080604-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall TCP ACK Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TCP ACK packet to the device to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.

Packets traversing the device cannot trigger this vulnerability.

Versions 7.1.x and 7.2.x with WebVPN, SSL VPN, or ASDM enabled are affected.  Version 8.0 with Telnet, Secure Shell (SSH), WebVPN, SSL VPN, or ASDM enabled is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsm84110 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1(2)70, 7.2(4), 8.0(3)10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080604-asa.shtml

Title: ZyWALL Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ZyWALL.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The device does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the HTTP Referer header parameter before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted request that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the ZyWALL software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Deniz Cevik reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the ZyWALL software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: WatchGuard Firebox PPTP VPN Discloses Whether Usernames are Valid or Invalid
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in WatchGuard Firebox.  A remote user can determine valid PPTP VPN usernames.
The PPTP VPN service returns different error codes during the MS-CHAPv2 authentication handshake for valid usernames and invalid usernames.  The system will return an 'E=691 Authentication Failure' error response for a valid username with an incorrect password and an 'E=649 No dialin permission' error response for an invalid username.

The vendor was notified on November 5, 2007.

Luke Jennings of MWR InfoSecurity reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.mwrinfosecurity.com/publications/mwri_watchguard-firebox-pptp-vpn-user-enumeration-advisory_2008-04-04.pdf
Impact': A remote user can determine valid PPTP VPN usernames.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (10), available at:

https://www.watchguard.com/archive/softwarecenter.asp

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall TTL Decrement Feature Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 500 Series; 7.2(2) to prior to 7.2(3)006; 8.0 prior to 8.0(3)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet to cause the target device to reload.  The system is vulnerable when the Time-to-Live (TTL) decrement feature is enabled (not the default configuration).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk48199 to this vulnerability.

Cisco ASA is also affected.

The Cisco Firewall Services Module is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (7.2(3)006 and 8.0(3)).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080123-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA TTL Decrement Feature Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 5500 Series; 7.2(2) to prior to 7.2(3)006; 8.0 prior to 8.0(3)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet to cause the target device to reload.  The system is vulnerable when the Time-to-Live (TTL) decrement feature is enabled (not the default configuration).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk48199 to this vulnerability.

Cisco PIX is also affected.

The Cisco Firewall Services Module is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (7.2(3)006 and 8.0(3)).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080123-asa.shtml

Title: Ingate Firewall Lets Remote Users Consume All Available SIP Media Ports
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ingate Firewall.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
In certain call hold and send-only stream situations, SIP media ports are not reused.  A remote user can consume all available SIP media ports, preventing new calls from being set up.
Impact': A remote user can prevent calls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (4.6.1).

The Ingate advisory is available at:

http://www.ingate.com/relnote-461.php

Title: Cisco Firewall Service Module Application Inspection Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Service Module (FWSM).  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the Layer 7 Application Inspection process and cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsl08519 to this vulnerability.

Cisco discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issue a fixed version (3.2(4)), to be available the week beginning 31st December 2007 at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/cat6000-fwsm?psrtdcat20e2

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20071219-fwsm.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA TLS and MGCP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASA.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TLS requests to cause the target device to reload if certain TLS-based functions (e.g., clientless WebVPN, HTTPS management, cut-through proxy for network access, and TLS proxy for encrypted voice inspection) are enabled.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg43276 and CSCsh97120 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) packets to cause the target device to reload if MGCP application layer protocol inspection is enabled (not the default configuration).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi90468 to this vulnerability.

Cisco and Cisco customers discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (7.0(7), 7.1(3), 7.2(3), and 8.0(2)), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/asa?psrtdcat20e2

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20071017-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall TLS and MGCP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TLS requests to cause the target device to reload if certain TLS-based functions (e.g., clientless WebVPN, HTTPS management, cut-through proxy for network access, and TLS proxy for encrypted voice inspection) are enabled.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg43276 and CSCsh97120 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) packets to cause the target device to reload if MGCP application layer protocol inspection is enabled (not the default configuration).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi90468 to this vulnerability.

Cisco and Cisco customers discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (7.0(7), 7.1(3), 7.2(3), and 8.0(2)), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/pix?psrtdcat20e2

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20071017-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco Firewall Service Module HTTPS and MGCP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Firewall Service Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user may be able to bypass access control lists.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTPS requests to cause the target device to reload if the HTTPS server is enabled (not the default configuration).  Versions 3.1(5) and prior and version 3.2(1) are affected by the HTTPS vulnerability.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi77844 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) packets to cause the target device to reload if MGCP application layer protocol inspection is enabled (not the default configuration).  Version 3.1(5) and prior 3.1 versions are affected.  Versions 2.3.x and 3.2.x are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi00694 to this vulnerability.

The PIX 500 Series Security Appliances and the Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances are affected by the MGCP vulnerability.

The access control list may not work properly after being modified by an authenticated administrator.  This may allow a remote user to bypass the firewall or may deny traffic that should otherwise be permitted.  Deleting and re-adding access control entries can trigger this vulnerability.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj52536 to this vulnerability. 

Cisco and Cisco customers discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

A remote user may be able to bypass access controls in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (3.1(7) and 3.2(3)).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20071017-fwsm.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco PIX) RSA BSAFE ASN.1 Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in RSA BSAFE.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Cisco PIX is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted ASN.1 encoded data to trigger a parsing flaw and cause the linked application to crash.

The RSA BSAFE Crypto-C and Cert-C libraries (and applications that link to these libraries) are affected.

RSA has assigned Bug ID 46337 to this vulnerability.

US-CERT reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/754281
Impact': A remote user can cause the target application or device to crash.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix for Cisco PIX, which is affected by this RSA BSAFE vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070522-crypto.shtml

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall DHCP Relay Agent Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When the DHCP relay agent function is enabled, a remote user can send a large number of DHCP packets to consume excessive memory resources on the target device. This will cause the target device to stop forwarding packets.

Systems configured with more than one DHCP server via the dhcprelay server command are vulnerable.

Systems configured with only a single DHCP server via the dhcprelay server command are not affected.

The Firewall Services Module (FWSM) is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsh50277 to this vulnerability.

Lisa Sittler and Grant Deffenbaugh of CERT/CC discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop forwarding packets.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (7.2(2.15)), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/pix-interim

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070502-pix.shtml

Title: Cisco PIX Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass LDAP Authentication and Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco PIX.  A remote user can bypass LDAP authentication.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can bypass authentication on devices that use LDAP AAA servers for authenticating L2TP IPSec tunnels.  Devices configured to use LDAP in conjunction with CHAP, MS-CHAPv1, or MS-CHAPv2 for authenticating L2TP IPSec tunnels are affected.

A remote user can bypass authentication on devices that use LDAP AAA servers for authenticating management sessions.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsh42793 to this vulnerability.

A remote user with knowledge of an IPSec VPN group name and group password can deny service to the VPN tunnel when configured with password expiry.  The target device may reload.

A remote user can deny service to an SSL VPN tunnel when configured with password expiry.  The target device may reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsh81111 to this vulnerability.

These vulnerabilities were reported to Cisco by Cisco customers.
Impact':
A remote user may be able to access the internal network or the target device.

A remote user can disconnect VPN users, prevent new connections, prevent the device from transmitting traffic, or cause the device to reload.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixed versions (7.1(2)49, 7.2(2)19).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070502-asa.shtml

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote authenticated user can obtain administrative privileges on the target system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target device to reload under certain conditions.

The vulnerability can be triggered by specific Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP), Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), and Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) traffic.

The vulnerability occurs only when HTTP inspection is enabled via a specific HTTP map in the configuration file, when SIP fixup or inspect is enabled, or when any of the following TCP-based protocols are inspected:

  * Computer Telephony Interface Quick Buffer Encoding (CITQBE)
  * Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call (DCE/RPC)
  * Domain Name Service (DNS)
  * Extended Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (ESMTP)
  * File Transfer Protocol (FTP)
  * H.323 protocol
  * Hyper Text Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
  * Internet Locator Server (ILS)
  * Instant Messaging (IM)
  * Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP)
  * Remote Shell (RSH)
  * Real Time Streaming Protocol (RTSP)
  * Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)
  * Skinny (or Simple) Client Control Protocol (SCCP)
  * Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP)
  * Oracle SQL*Net
  * Sun RPC

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsd75794, CSCse27708, CSCsd97077, and CSCsh12711 to this vulnerability.

When the LOCAL method is used for user authentication, a remote authenticated user that is defined in the local database with a privilege of zero can obtain elevated privileges (to and including level 15, administrative privileges).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsh33287 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote authenticated user can obtain administrative privileges in certain configurations.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixed versions (6.3(5.115), 7.0(5.2), 7.1(2.5), and 7.2(2.10)), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/pix

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070214-pix.shtml

Description:

  * Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call (DCE/RPC)
  * Domain Name Service (DNS)
  * Extended Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (ESMTP)
  * File Transfer Protocol (FTP)
  * H.323 protocol
  * Hyper Text Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
  * Internet Locator Server (ILS)
  * Instant Messaging (IM)

  * Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)
  * Skinny (or Simple) Client Control Protocol (SCCP)
  * Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP)

When the LOCAL method is used for user authentication, a remote authenticated user that is defined in the local database with a privilege of zero can obtain elevated privileges (to and including level 15, administrative privileges).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsh33287 to this vulnerability.

Solution:
Cisco has issued fixed versions (6.3(5.115), 7.0(5.2), 7.1(2.5), and 7.2(2.10)), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/asa

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070214-pix.shtml

Title: Cisco Firewall Service Module Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Bypass Intended ACLs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Service Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user may be able to bypass ACLs.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target device to reload under certain conditions.  When verbose logging is enabled and the FWSM processes packets destined to itself, the vulnerability can be triggered.

The vulnerability can be triggered by specific Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP), Secure HTTP (HTTPS), Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), and Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) traffic.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsd75794, CSCsg80915, CSCse85707, CSCsg50228, CSCsd91268, CSCsf29974, and CSCse52679 to this vulnerability.

When an authenticated administrator manipulates access control lists (ACLs) that use object groups, the ACL may be corrupted.  As a result, traffic intended to be blocked may be permitted and traffic intended to be permitted may be blocked.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCse60868 and CSCse99740 to this ACL vulnerability.

Some of these vulnerabilities were reported to Cisco by customers and some were discovered by Cisco.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload under certain configurations.

A remote user may be able to gain access to hosts and networks intended to be blocked by the firewall.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixed versions (2.3(4.12), 3.1(4)), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/cat6000-fwsm?psrtdcat20e2

For 2.3(4.12):

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/FWSMPSIRT?psrtdcat20e2

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070214-fwsm.shtml

Title: Cisco PIX Firewall May Change Certain Passwords
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  Certain passwords may be inadvertently changed by the system.
The software contains a flaw that may cause passwords stored in the startup configuration to be changed without user interaction. The EXEC password, passwords of locally defined users, and the enable password are affected.

The flaw may be triggered by a software crash or when two or more users are making concurrent configuration changes on the target device.

The passwords are changed to a non-random value due to the nature of the coding error that causes this behavior.

Versions prior to 7.x and version 7.2(1) and later are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse02703 to this vulnerability.

Cisco credits Terje Bless from Helse Nord IKT with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': The system may change certain passwords without user interaction.
Solution:
Cisco has issued the following fixed versions: 7.0(5.1), 7.1(2.5) (and later releases).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060823-firewall.shtml

Title: Cisco ASA May Change Certain Passwords
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA.  Certain passwords may be inadvertently changed by the system.
The software contains a flaw that may cause passwords stored in the startup configuration to be changed without user interaction. The EXEC password, passwords of locally defined users, and the enable password are affected.

The flaw may be triggered by a software crash or when two or more users are making concurrent configuration changes on the target device.

The passwords are changed to a non-random value due to the nature of the coding error that causes this behavior.

Version 7.2(1) and later are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse02703 to this vulnerability.

Cisco credits Terje Bless from Helse Nord IKT with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': The system may change certain passwords without user interaction.
Solution:
Cisco has issued the following fixed versions: 7.0(5.1), 7.1(2.5) (and later releases).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060823-firewall.shtml

Title: Cisco Firewall Services Module May Change Certain Passwords
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Firewall Services Module for the Cisco Catalyst 6500 switches and Cisco 7600 Series routers.  Certain passwords may be inadvertently changed by the system.
The software contains a flaw that may cause passwords stored in the startup configuration to be changed without user interaction. The EXEC password, passwords of locally defined users, and the enable password are affected.

The flaw may be triggered by a software crash or when two or more users are making concurrent configuration changes on the target device.

The passwords are changed to a non-random value due to the nature of the coding error that causes this behavior.

Versions 1.x and 2.x and version 3.1(2) and later are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsd81487 to this vulnerability.

Cisco credits Terje Bless from Helse Nord IKT with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': The system may change certain passwords without user interaction.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fixed version (3.1(2) and later), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/cat6000-fwsm 

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060823-firewall.shtml

Title: Ingate Firewall Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ingate Firewall.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
If TLS is enabled for the SIP module, a remote user can send specially crafted SSL/TLS data to the SIP module cause the target service to crash and restart.  The web service is also affected.

The device does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.
